The game's cute and lovable catgirl cast, accompanied by their adorable and amusing personalities, make for a delightful journey filled with laughter and endearing moments. The captivating visual design, soothing soundtrack, and well-written dialogue create an immersive and cozy atmosphere that draws you into the world of La Soleil. Whether you're following the heartwarming interactions between the protagonist and the catgirls or exploring their unique stories, NEKOPARA Vol. 1 is a heartwarming and delightful visual novel that will leave you with a warm and fuzzy feeling. Get ready to indulge in a sweet and charming adventure that celebrates friendship, love, and the joy of having adorable feline companions. NEKOPARA Vol. 1 is a must-play for fans of romance and catgirl enthusiasts everywhere.

comentarios: NEKOPARA Vol.1 looks like it fits 100% into an outsider’s view of visual novels; a dull, fandom-focused story with pretty girls who do nothing but dote on you. Yes, these catgirls are pretty devoted, but there’s more going on than a simple harem storyline. One can’t help but be intrigued by Kashou’s devotion to baking, understanding both catgirls, and wanting to see everything turn out well. With that said, some may be put off by the sexual storyline aspect which suddenly shows up. Others might be mad knowing they’ve missed out on some scenes due to Steam’s restrictions on adult content. Still, NEKOPARA is a light and fluffy visual novel that fans of catgirls will enjoy their time with.

comentarios: I like visual novels. I like catgirls. I like boobs and sex and sexy things. This has nice visuals. There's even a  slider to control the amount of boob bounce if that's your thing.  I'm not in any way a prude.  But there's no actual choices or gameplay involved, its just a straight auto-playing game.  Basically an anime with no budget.  And that's fine, visual novels are what they are, not all of them need branching paths or illusion of choice. They hae a particular story to tell, its a novel rather than a dating sim.  That's fine.  What's not fine is the main relationship.  The two main characters are treated and aged like children.  They're mentally cats.  They're sisters.  They call the player their master.  The player character EXPLICITLY thinks of them as his "daughters". And then they have sex. It's just really gross.  Incest, pedophilia AND bestiality all in one package.  The story was kind of cute at first but then they started making long analogies about flowers having sex and then one of them being in heat and it just got really squicky.  I feel like I'm on a watch list now.

comentarios: This review is for the whole Nekopara series on steam.  Pros -great art -extremely moe -decent voice acting -cute slice of life story -little sister has a brother complex  Cons -no decisions / story branches -auto mode sometimes skips multiple lines of text -bad pacing -the split into multiple volume means entering your settings every volume and CGs are split between different games as well as paying for each volume including the three different paywalls to the H scenes -each volume is short enough to be read in one sitting -cant romance the sister  There's really not much to say about this. It was a good time reading it but there were no decisions basically making the save menu useless. This makes it feel like a shit manga with voice acting and awkward character animations. This game is pure moe trash which i love but if i'm paying for moe trash i want more out of it like in other visual novels with branching story lines or like in the neptunia series where you get a full game and moe trash. If i wanted to read and look at cute anime girls i would read manga (for free).   Worst of all there is no romancing the little sister and no little sister H scene. This is the offence that caused me to write this review.

comentarios: Excellent characters, excellent music and astoudingly good art. One of the most high-quality, high-effort Visual Novels I've played in some time.   I'd really advise against getting the +18 patch though. A lot of people could argue that the whole "heat" arc was essential to the plot, but I think these were made just for the sake of fanservice and do not actually contribute anything meaningful to the story or overall game. They're just SO stretched out, awkward and plain unpleasant. One of the few ocassions where I would intentionally turn down and skip hentai scenes in a VN, or any game for that matter.  Aside from that though, it's a solid 8/10. Definitely worth the purchase

comentarios: This game saved my life.  I am 41.  My ex-wife and I have a daughter together, and adopted our son together. They are now both 4 years old.  When we were going through our separation, I found myself lost and miserable. I was self destructive. I got so mad one day from everything spiraling out of my control that I punched some concrete in a moment of overwhelming emotion. That caused me to break my 5th metacarpal in my right hand... my working hand... my games hand.. the hand that I held and carried my children to bed with.. The hand I desperately needed to make sure I could continue to provide.  After learning of the severity of my self-inflicted damage, I was borderline suicidal. Keep in mind that just a few months before this, I was the happiest man with no history of depression or anxiety. I have never had fits of rage, or been one to break down and cry, but I was in a low spot that just really buried me from being able to see the light on the other side.  Having nothing better to do, I searched for a game I could play, ONE HANDED while I recovered. I somehow stumbled upon this game and read some of the reviews. I decided that it had to be worth a shot... I must admit, I didn't beat the game, or play nearly as long as some of you. In fact, I may have only played this game a day or two.. With that being said, after doing so, I had a new found joy and hope for life. I was able to put behind me the pain and suffering that had been cast over me. I was able to experience other peoples joy and happiness. I was able to see the fruits of my "labor". I relaxed for 5 minutes to this music long enough to realize that I was going to be okay. After coming to that realization, I turned the game off, and I went back to work. It hurt my hand like hell but I was motivated. I stopped feeling so damn sorry for myself, and I became the father I needed to be in that moment, not the weak boy I was behaving as.  Today, I am close friend with my kids mother. We don't fight, or argue, or say hurtful things to each other. We are parents, and friends.  I now have 3 kids. My third child is, wait for it, ALSO 4 YEARS OLD. The woman I am with was going through a very similar situation at the time of my own separation, and we just stumbled in to each others life unexpectedly. We have been in a relationship for a year now, and are very happy together.  Moral of the story, you never know what life holds in store for you, and if I would have given up when all the odds were stacked against me, I wouldn't be where I am today. This silly little game helped me realize that.

comentarios: How to make Chocola Fudge  INGREDIENTS 2 Cups white sugar 4 Tablespoon butter 1/2 Cup cocoa 1 Teaspoon vanilla extract 1 Cup milk   INSTRUCTIONS - Grease an 8x8 inch square baking pan. Set aside. - Combine sugar, cocoa and milk in a medium saucepan. Stir to blend, then bring to a boil, stirring constantly. Reduce heat and simmer. Do not stir again.  - Place candy thermometer in pan and cook until temperature reaches 238 degrees F(114 degrees C). If you are not using a thermometer, then cook until a drop of this mixture in a cup of cold water forms a soft ball. Feel the ball with your fingers to make sure it is the right consistency. It should flatten when pressed between your fingers.  - Remove from heat. Add butter or margarine and vanilla extract. Beat with a wooden spoon until the fudge loses its sheen. Do not under beat.  - Pour into prepared pan and let cool. Cut into about 60 squares.   Enjoy.

comentarios: Now that I've fully finished this game, I feel that I can now write something about this game.   For the most part, it's just a slice of life type game so if you're not into that, then save your $10. For the game itself, I really liked the artwork as that stood out to me the most (NIS, IF, Compile Heart pls take notes). The characters were okay but it felt like the story wasn't going anywhere. The H scenes are ripped out of the steam version so it leads the player on to sex then automatically reverts to after-sex. Felt that was kinda lazy as it could have been just re-written instead.  I'd give this a C. It was okay but could have been better.   If you like slice of life, catgirls, or little bit of funny here or there then I'd buy it.  If not, save money.

comentarios: It was hard to enjoy this.  Kashou is a bit of a pushover and doormat. His underage sister Shigure is tsundere, creepy and invasive, and wants to fuck him. Chocola is loud and annoying, and Vanilla gets a little mean-spirited later on. The game/dialogue is *constantly* saying "They're acting like this because they're catgirls", as though to continuously reference and remind me of the point of the game, and one of those traits gets completely contradicted later on anyways ([spoiler]they're honest because they're catgirls, but Vanilla lies about something she gets embarrassed about[/spoiler]). The catgirls are compared to daughters immediately after a sex scene ([spoiler]since Kashou did raise them from their childhood, oh also they're twin sisters yet they interact sexually with each other[/spoiler]). They occasionally say "no, stop" during sex which isn't respected at all, and they're extremely shrill and high-pitched during it. They act young and naive, almost child-like at times, [spoiler]because catgirls have less intelligence than humans[/spoiler], which is not a turn-on at all.  I know that the incest, loli-bait, screeching during sex, and violating consent is all normal for hentai, but it's still not enjoyable. I also think this is important to know, because every other review is just dumbass jokes and won't talk about the actual damn game.

The bad : • [strike]No Maple's route[/strike] • Now I have to wait for Vol 2 :(  If you want a good laugh, or if you like nekomimi, or both of them, grab this one. comentarios: Ahhh this VN has made me fall out of my chair, cry rivers and lose my breath on multiple occasions, generally due to immense amount of laughter or daaawwww moments. Its well written and has nice transitions for whenever something is being taken into reference (recalling an event or such)  I took a while to start it up but once i did there was no getting me to stop it till the end and i can say wholeheartedly that this is among my favourite VNs ive played/read over the years, sure there arent any choices to be made but i dont mind, for the price thats asked id say its worth it. Its not got any big drama in it nor any looming *doom* hanging over it per say, its more Chocolatey with a sprinkle of Vanilla so as to not make it too.... single coloured :-)  Would have to say the production value in Vol. 1 is pretty darn good, didnt notice any bad scenes and the transition between still images to animated ones felt natural. Also love the options (youll see what i mean;-)   9/10 from me (cant be 10 yet as the series isnt done) ^^

comentarios: NekoPara Vol 1. is an adult oriented, though there is an All-Ages version available, VN featuring adorable catgirls and is the 1st of a series of 3. There are no choices to be had just plain ol’ reading/listening & a few vanilla sex scenes in the 18+ version, this is an Eroge not a Nukige, so the sex is not the aim of the game, one does not equal the other. It features only Japanese voice acting, a lot of it & for everyone but the MC. The story follows Kashou Minaduki, an aspiring baker who has recently moved away from his family for reasons to open up his own shop. Metal Gear Solid style our 2 main catgirls, Chocola & Vanilla, have snuck in inside of his moving boxes. After some back & forth they convince poor baker boy to let them stay.  Right out the bat I will say that the overarching story is a bit drab as this is an introductory game, though individual characters show some growth so it isn’t all that bad & has its funny as well as its share of sad moments.  The story is presented in the VN style of text boxes & sprites, though the sprites are animated using ‘E-mote’, a system akin to Live2D. It is pretty amazing seeing what would normally be plain static images come to life as they express themselves in various ways as they talk. This feature is also used on most of the sex scenes to great effect. Standard art is also used, with some chibi art used on comedic occasions & backgrounds fitting the overall style, which I appreciate. Music is decent with most of it being cheery stuff and a few somber tracks.  Option wise, it is also the standard VN affair for the most part, with sliders for sound volume, text box transparency, etc. The game features Chinese along with Japanese & English text, as mentioned voices will always be Japanese. You can customize the sound volume for each character along with extra voices. The ‘E-mote’ system allow for... chest bounciness (Press the ‘P’ on your keyboard, trust me) which you can customize with a slider too, though I must be blind since I didn’t see much change.  All in all, Neko Para Vol. 1 is a beautiful, but only ok storywise VN that would be of best value when purchased at a discount as the story was very tame & serving as more of stepping stone to the sequels. The art & usage of ‘E-mote’ to bring to life sprites is pretty amazing & something to be experienced & will definitely continue to experience as soon as I get my hands on the sequels. With a 3rd one in the works along with an anime OVA fans are sure to have plenty of NekoPara for a while to come.

comentarios: After seeing all the accolades, I decided to take a chance when this title went on sale....and I now regret it.  First, if you are interested in this title for its erotic content, know ahead of time that this content was completely removed by Steam.  If you desire that content, you need to go to the developer's website and pay $10 for a patch to restore the content.  Second, if you are interested in this title for its storyline, I personally found it dull and tiresome.  Seiously, the story basically goes like this:  Vanilla:  Master, can we have shampoo for our hair? Chocola: You are mean!  We want shampoo for our hair! Narrator:  We did not come to the market to buy shampoo. Vanilla: (whines) But we want shampoo! Chocola:  The shampoo makes our hair nice. Both: PLEASE! Narrator: No, we are here to buy grocieries.  and on.....and on...and on....  This isn't quite verbatim, but it's an accurate reflection.  Third, if you're interested in the anime graphics, they are fine, but I've seen both far better and far worse.  Admittedly, I could invest more hours of my life into this "game" and hope it gets better, but since the beginning failed to grab my attention (the first rule of writing a good book is to seize the reader's attention--because this is really a book, not a game), it doesn't bode well.  I do not recommend it.  EDIT:   I forced myself to finish Nekopara 1.  It does eventually get better, and there are some erotic scenes, but you have to grind through a lot of annoying dialogue to get there.  I'm currently playing Nekopara 2 which gets to the action more quickly.  There's enough dialogue to develop the characters without it getting annoying.  I think that the developers learned from the first one and made the second one better.

comentarios: Got to admit, I think the sexual content actively interferes with the novel. Steam's censored version is the version I played and thankfully skips past the actual adult scenes and is one of the only instances where I feel like it would have been an inferior experience, but even in Steam's version the implications of what happened doesn't feel quite right.  Fortunately, that's about the only notable issue for me. It's otherwise an enjoyable experience in seeing the relationship develop between Kashou and his unexpected catgirls Chocola and Vanilla, especially as the catgirls struggle to fully understand the way humanity works. Seeing the three earnestly try to pursue what they believe to be the best for them all while trying to understand the bonds they have was very nice.  Nekopara is not without its humour and the novel delivers well on this too. A lot of it ends up tying into the catgirl tendencies to slip into cat-like behaviour, and while I wouldn't say every joke worked it definitely hit the mark more plenty to make it worthwhile.  It was also great to see the E-mote system in use for the visuals. The last time I'd seen this was Tokyo School Life, and the implementation here is even better as they're able to give some illusion of talking, walking about or leaning to the side as a few examples. While it's not the norm for visual novels the impact is massive and I do wish it would become more commonplace.  There are no choices to make in the novel though, with a single linear storyline to the end.

comentarios: I have to say, after playing some of the other VNs on steam, this one stands out above the crowd.  The animations of the characters, while a bit distracting at first, brings a sense of life to the story.  If you are fond of cats, catgirls, or cuteness in general, I would recommend giving this a try.   While this is the edited version of the game, the scenes that were cut out seem to not make a difference in the overall story, but are more or less fap material.  I originally was disappointed, but after finishing the game, I can say that I am perfectly comfortable not having seen the romance scenes in graphic detail, and the rather coy way that the game eludes to them makes it more cute in a way.    Anyhow, this is worth the price in my opinion, and I am genuinely happy that it caught my eye.  I am looking forward to Vol. 2.

comentarios: First off try the demo before buying. I did and it was the reason why I bought this. The game shows a follow tale of catgirls and their master. Now this game has a nice feel to it others don't provde. Like Live2d motion you have for the Ipad being instilled on this work. The characters move, blink, and react. They keep on screen and make good reactions with their expressions. The character work wasn't wasted. There is continuity and fluid movement. That is the heavy emphasis I saw. Nonetheless the tale takes a nice well drawn turn with many more introduced to the story. It goes on and out introducing more and each one showing their little bit of character. The two cats you have Chocola and Vanilla. These two are constantly in this story and have their interests with you. There are fun moments with more of the cast and the voices are synced. There are ways to change language just look at guides. Also the game supports English, Chinese, and Japanese Language with subtitles. The voice is what did well by it and the expressions I canot deny are cute. The telling of the story is good. OUT OF 10. This would be a 10. Thanks to the sense of this visual novel being able to give more. There is another version. However as of Vol 1. This thing hit top of my chart this year. Not a bad way to end 2014 ^_^ I enjoyed it.  If you get it now, I tell you won't regret it. This offered something other VNs lacked. Sure there's CG but you got to play it for yourself. I won't spoil it but it is good. The characters are all admirable in thier own way. Those who made it deserve the 10 as well kudos to you. Fans of this genre and game bro fist to you. Enjoy as I have ^_^

comentarios: Nekopara is a high quality kinetic novel (meaning no interactions, only reading) featuring catgirls and adult themes, although the Steam version is censored unless you apply some shenanigans to it (refer to this Community Hub link: http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=370848130). The voice acting is in Japanese with subs for Japanese, English, and Chinese.  The art is extremely well done and fairly crisp. I played in a 1600x900 resolution which appears to be as high as it goes. Fullscreen will give it black borders as the game will maintain its aspect ratio to prevent stretched catgirls (very important). The level of quality that Nekopara has in terms of its art assets remains consistent throughout the entire experience with good coloring, shadowing, and light animations to help give the characters life such as head turning, blinking, breathing, and breast jiggling depend on how you use that slider.  I have no complaints with the music. It has tunes ranging from upbeat to laidback and brought me closer to my inner anime. The game comes with a music player that can Play, Stop Repeat, and Repeat All should you decide to just chill out. The opening song is pretty good.  Finally, the story seemed appropriate for what it was trying to do. It had its fair share of funny and “What is going on?” moments. The story follows Kashou and how he handles the two catgirls, Chocola and Vanilla, coming into his life when he’s trying establish himself in the world as a baker. I don’t recommend thinking too hard about the rules that the world has regarding catgirls as those kind of discussions could lead to very strange places.  Voice acting seemed fine with tones that matched the dialogue. I really liked how they would say some of the verbs out loud. Rub, rub, for example. Or stare. That’s not something I’ve seen very often and adds a silly vibe to it.  Anyhoo, don’t purchase Nekopara for gameplay since there isn’t any. Your decision should be based on your interest in its story, the voice acting, the music, and the art.

comentarios: [b] Do you like catgirls? [/b] [b] Do you like anime? [/b] [b] Do you feel lonely and want to fill the void in your heart somehow? [/b] If you answered "yes" to at least one of these questions, then chances are you're going to like this game.  [h1] Overview [/h1] This visual novel follows the story of Minaduki Kashou, a man who wants to open his own patisserie. As he moves out of his family home, where catgirls reside along with him and his sister, he finds out two of the catgirls, Chocola and Vanilla, have decided to follow him, as they do not wish to be separated from him.  [h1] Story [/h1] The story is one the main points of focus of this game, it isn't complicated, and it doesn't have any sorrow instigating drama. While things don't always go perfectly, this story is one of those that just make you feel warm inside.  [h1] Gameplay [/h1] It is a visual novel, so the gameplay is about what you'd probably expect. Simple and compact, as that is all it needs to be.  [h1] Visuals and Audio [/h1] The art style and animations are very pleasant to the eye. The adorable catgirls' faces are bound to cleanse your soul. The UI is simple and attractively looking, though it might take a bit to get used to it at first. As for the voice acting, it is very well done, as you would find out especially if you had the 18+ patch.  [h1] Conclusion [/h1] It's a very enjoyable experience and I believe it is worth the 9,99€ you pay for this.

comentarios: Nekopara Vol 1  The Nekopara series is a wonderful series where its a world of humenoid modified catgirls were they are either pets, partners, or companions, some work as emplyees in the stores of there owners, or some are just friends to the owner or the family and or they can become a life partner to there owner.  The story is about a young man who decides to move out of his families house and start a new life and buiness by opening up a baking store, but it turns out that two of his families catgirls snuck in by hiding in some boxes and thats were the story begins. Thats all ill reveal of the story and plot.  The game is written very well full of funny moments and filled with some sad moments never to much of one type of drama they keep it very even and not repetitive I found myself laughing alot from the jokes and i also felt the feels when it was either a sad or seriouse moment.  The artwork in the game was done very well I love how the sprites have so much movement and such expressions within the game including the sound effects and voice over its a very good combination the devs have done with the game.  The music was composed very well it fits the mood of the situation within the game there is alot of songs within the game so it will not get to repetitive while you play the game.  I highly recommend this game if your a fan of anime,neko's,or just visual novel's this is one of the best vn's I have played in a good while I hope you all will enjoy the game as much as I have   ~Bloodwolf

comentarios: I am a 45 yo father, probably one of the oldest people playing this game. I am a single farther to my Son, who is 14 now. My son got this game for Christmas from his uncle, so we installed it on his computer and he started playing. By the end of the week he had 24 hours on this game. This was horrible for me, as it was already hard for me to find ways to spend time with my son, as he is always out with his friends or just, watching YouTube. So i decided to make a Steam account and get this game to see if I could maybe play alongside him. loaded into the game, made my character and world and started playing but I was stuck on what you where supposed to do. I asked my Son for help and he hosted a game for me to join. loved it as it was the best time had spent with my Son since my wife had died. This game has ever since brought me and my son closer again and now we actually spend time together outside the house together as well. This game reminded me that there's fun to be had in everything, and it has brought both me and my Son many happy memories.

comentarios: In case you're unaware, Valve are forcing all eroge developers to release censored versions on steam. As kotaku points out, there are plenty of games that don't get censored for sexual content, including The Witcher franchise and of course, GTA.  This 'game', in the very strictest sense, is a Visual Novel, the story is completely linear and there are no choices for different paths, having said that, I'm not sure I'd want to spend the time do multiple paths either. The story so far has been pretty boring and uneventful, the visuals are 'nice' especially when streamed to the Gear VR HMD - Chocola' name badge is massive.   It seems that most of the effort has gone into animating the Neko's breasts and stripping content, and while this may be a draw for some, it doesn't quite have the depth you expect from a highly rated eroge.  I'd love to recommend this, but I'm only going to continue 'playing' in case the prequel/sequel improve upon the above points.  Unlikely I would wear a blue penguin T-shirt again.

comentarios: I've been a fan of Sayori's artwork for years now, and I've waited anxiously for a day that Neko Works would produce some kind of game with her gorgeous artwork. It's finally here, and it's everything you could ask for: HD artwork, fully voiced, and a high quality emofuri-inspired animation engine. Seeing these characters come to life outside of art books and short ero comics gives me huge moe feels.  You should buy this if you obsess over catgirls or are looking for another short VN to play. Pick up the original ero release on DLsite too. :chocola:

comentarios: Maybe the first visual novel I have played, so I know I might sound a little harsh and perhaps even biased, please excuse that. This game is mainly made to be enjoyed by anime girl lovers, and cat girls are a huge plus. This game can definetly make you one of us cat girl enjoyers, even if you were not very inclined towards them in the past (my case, used to despise them). The plot is a little weak, nor do I like the style of visual novels (if you like vn's this should not be an issue), but the cat girls are very much cute, and the anime girl cutie energy is there. The h-scenes follows the visual novel style, so if you do not like the art style this game's magic will not work very well, and it may feel slow and boring. To summerise, you like anime girls this game will work, if do not like vn's maybe avoid this game, the h-scenes are styled like vn's, so not liking vn's will make the h-scenes crap. Important: the h-scenes have to be bought seperately as a 18+ dlc, and also press p to make their coconuts jiggle in game. Overall this game is positive for me, Happy gaming my brothers.

comentarios: Honestly, this game is way over-rated. There's practically no conflict in the story, and what little exists is solved within a few slides of being created. There are *literally* no choices to make so that kills replayability.  Basically, you're this guy opening a bakery and everything just seems to go your way and everyone seems to love you for no appearent reason. The "love" everyone has for you doesn't feel remotely real and feels incredibly forced. As for the sex scenes, this is the pg edited version that has awkward jump-cuts jutted in there jumping straight to the aftermath when they're asleep and under the covers.  However, I will say if you're looking for a feel-good, happy-go-lucky, cutsie story, then this is for you.  Overall, I'd give this game a C+. It's a passing grade, but it's not all that great.  P.S. If you're looking for fap material, you can put the tissues away, because there isn't any. This had very little effect on my rating, because, tbh, I dislike visual novels that randomly throw in an extremely graphic sex scene here and there, making it risky to play with someone else in the room.

comentarios: This game, much like vol. 0 did, will make you question your life. [i]What am I doing with my life?[/i]  This game, is unique to it's story, it teaches you a lot in the relationship between 2 catgirls, how to care and look after them, and what to do and not do as an owner. [spoiler]But let's face it, you just came for the explicit content...[/spoiler]  The game starts off quite what you'd expect, you are a business owner and you have just moved out of the house to try and make a living. But of course, let's not forget, you have extra boxes of stuff that you [i]didn't[/i] order. Which turns out that someone else ordered, you and the delivery woman take care of that and so it then on progresses to you noticing 2 boxes with strange labels on it, that has no delivery notice or anything. You hear a sound from the boxes, and notice that it's the catgirls from the home you moved out from.  As the story progresses you become more and more attached to them, eventually making said catgirls your "catpanions". In other words, they are basically your girlfriends in bed and for life. [spoiler]( ͡° ͜ʖ ͡°)[/spoiler]  If you are like me, then you will probably chat with other people 90% of the time and the remaning 10% just not care about the explicit scenes. Though, this makes the game appear longer than what it is, partially because it's not really suited for everyone's taste.   To summarize, I enjoyed the story, the details were good and, (I never thought I would say this) felt some kind of attachment to the catgirls. Don't blame me, I like to read, but I aint a bookworm.  It's a good game to "troll" your friends with, but I wouldn't recommend buying it for full price unless you basically have no worries about your economical situation (unlike me).  [spoiler]Though, you should convince them to install the "special patch" for full effect[/spoiler]  10/10, would learn how to get emotionally attached to virtual catgirls again.

comentarios: The first of the many games so far (4 games total atm Nekopara Vol1-3 and a prequel Vol 0)  Our main protagonist Kashou leaves his family and starts up his shop called La Soleil (a cake and patisserie/ Pastry shop)  When the unexpected happens two of his family "cats" Chocola and Vanilla ended up being delivered to his new store/home with him thanks to his sister   and then the adventures start with Kashou starting up his business and looking after her two catgirls or Neko's if you prefer.  It's pretty good just like all the others (depending if you played VOl 0 first or if this is your first) The design/art of this game is really great and is worth the money. (imo)  Only thing I kind of wish they could've added to this game were decision making but I guess it would take alot longer and more money to do that stuff ether way though it's a really fun game and again worth the money.   (And if you’re wondering why I'm doing a review with the amount of hours I have in it, it's because I had vol 0-2 on my other steam account before I lost it so yeah... REVIEW!!)

comentarios: Good Evening, My Fellow Citizens: This government, as promised, has maintained the closest surveillance of the Soviet military buildup on the island of Cuba. Within the past week, unmistakable evidence has established the fact that a series of offensive missile sites is now in preparation on that imprisoned island. The purpose of these bases can be none other than to provide a nuclear strike capability against the Western Hemisphere. Upon receiving the first preliminary hard information of this nature last Tuesday morning at 9 a.m., I directed that our surveillance be stepped up. And having now confirmed and completed our evaluation of the evidence and our decision on a course of action, this government feels obliged to report this new crisis to you in fullest detail. The characteristics of these new missile sites indicate two distinct types of installations. Several of them include medium range ballistic missiles, capable of carrying a nuclear warhead for a distance of more than 1,000 nautical miles. Each of these missiles, in short, is capable of striking Washington, D.C., the Panama Canal, Cape Canaveral, Mexico City, or any other city in the southeastern part of the United States, in Central America or in the Caribbean area.  Additional sites not yet completed appear to be designed for intermediate range ballistic missiles -- capable of traveling more than twice as far -- and thus capable of striking most of the major cities in the Western Hemisphere, ranging as far north as Hudson Bay, Canada, and as far south as Lima, Peru. In addition, jet bombers capable of carrying nuclear weapons are now being uncrated and assembled in Cuba while the necessary air bases are being prepared. This urgent transformation of Cuba into an important strategic base -- by the presence of these large, long-range, and clearly offensive weapons of sudden mass destruction -- constitutes an explicit threat to the peace and security of all Americas, in flagrant and deliberate defiance of the Rio Pact of 1947, the traditions of this nation and hemisphere, the joint resolution of the 87th Congress, the Charter of the United Nations, and my own public warnings to the Soviets on September 4 and 13. This action also contradicts the repeated assurances of Soviet spokesmen, both publicly and privately delivered, that the arms buildup in Cuba would retain its original defensive character, and that the Soviet Union had no need or desire to station strategic missiles on the territory of any other nation. ... But this secret, swift and extraordinary buildup of communist missiles -- in an area well known to have a special and historical relationship to the United States and the nations of the Western Hemisphere, in violation of Soviet assurances, and in defiance of American and hemispheric policy -- the sudden, clandestine decision to station strategic weapons for first time outside of Soviet soil -- is a deliberately provocative and unjustified change in the status quo which cannot be accepted by this country, if our courage and our commitments are ever to be trusted again by either friend or foe. ... Acting, therefore, in the defense of our own security and of the entire Western Hemisphere, and under the authority entrusted to me by the Constitution as endorsed by the resolution of the Congress, I have directed that the following initial steps be taken immediately: First: To halt this offensive buildup, a strict quarantine on all offensive military equipment under shipment to Cuba is being initiated. All ships of any kind bound for Cuba from whatever nation and port will, if found to contain cargoes of offensive weapons, be turned back. This quarantine will be extended, if needed, to other types of cargo and carriers. We are not at this time, however, denying the necessities of life as the Soviets attempted to do in their Berlin blockade of 1948.  Second: I have directed the continued and increased close surveillance of Cuba and its military buildup. The foreign ministers of the OAS, in their communique of October 6, rejected secrecy on such matters in this hemisphere. Should these offensive military preparations continue, thus increasing the threat to the hemisphere, further action will be justified. I have directed the Armed Forces to prepare for any eventualities; and I trust that in the interest of both the Cuban people and the Soviet technicians at the sites, the hazards to all concerned of continuing the threat will be recognized. Third: It shall be the policy of this nation to regard any nuclear missile launched from Cuba against any nation in the Western Hemisphere as an attack on the United States, requiring a full retaliatory response upon the Soviet Union. Fourth: As a necessary military precaution, I have reinforced our base at Guantanamo, evacuated today the dependents of our personnel there, and ordered additional military units to be on a standby alert status. Fifth: We are calling tonight for an immediate meeting of the Organ of Consultation under the Organization of American States, to consider this threat to hemispheric security and to invoke articles 6 and 8 of the Rio Treaty in support of all necessary action. The United Nations Charter allows for regional security arrangements -- and the nations of this hemisphere decided long ago against the military presence of outside powers. Our other allies around the world have also been alerted. Sixth: Under the Charter of the United Nations, we are asking tonight that an emergency meeting of the Security Council be convoked without delay to take action against this latest Soviet threat to world peace. Our resolution will call for the prompt dismantling and withdrawal of all offensive weapons in Cuba, under the supervision of U.N. observers, before the quarantine can be lifted. Seventh and finally: I call upon Chairman Khrushchev to halt and eliminate this clandestine, reckless, and provocative threat to world peace and to stable relations between our two nations. I call upon him further to abandon this course of world domination, and to join in an historic effort to end the perilous arms race and to transform the history of man. He has an opportunity now to move the world back from the abyss of destruction -- by returning to his government's own words that it had no need to station missiles outside its own territory, and withdrawing these weapons from Cuba -- by refraining from any action which will widen or deepen the present crisis -- and then by participating in a search for peaceful and permanent solutions. ... My fellow citizens: let no one doubt that this is a difficult and dangerous effort on which we have set out. No one can foresee precisely what course it will take or what costs or casualties will be incurred. Many months in which both our patience and our will will be tested -- months in which many threats and denunciations will keep us aware of our dangers. But the greatest danger of all would be to do nothing. ...  Our goal is not the victory of might, but the vindication of right -- not peace at the expense of freedom, but both peace and freedom, here in this hemisphere, and we hope, around the world. God willing, that goal will be achieved. Thank you and good night.

comentarios: Slow to start, but it gets better as you progress through the chapters. Unfortunately, if you're looking for a game to interact with then you're better off purchasing any of the other Nekopara games in the series as this one functions more as an animated visual novel.   Again, there is an 18+ adult content DLC if that interests you.   The music is a little repetitive and there are large gaps in which there is no audio outside of the background music since Kashou has no spoken lines. There is also a large amount of time in which the story focuses on the same image. I adjusted my settings to allow for the auto play feature to be active so it may be better to leave the text speed alone and navigate yourself if you don't want such lengthy scenes.   All in all, it's a sweet story and I did enjoy it. Even if it was a tad dry in places.

comentarios: A very well made and polished VN (Visual Novel).  ~A story of a Baker and his 2 pet Nekomimis (Catgirls)~  I never was into visual novels but he linked me this. It was okay considering voice acting, animations, music and chest boun...ci...ness...? "Oohh, it's one of those VNs..." This kind of harem story line is a clïche almost in any Visual and/or Anime. It's popular so go with the flow.  Since it's a Novel of a Visual sensation it features text. And alot of it. If you are here to collect rather expensive steam cards you'll be clicking through this game. If you are a person who likes deep reading, catching character desing and story this is for you.  ~Possible spoiler alert~ Least into 3 hours of auto-advancing things start to "heat up". And what do I mean by this...? As Cpt. Pickard would say: "Set course for Intercourse.  Would I recommend? Yes. I never experienced A VN proper than this. And I didn't care about the "intercourse" the story and the characters are the key here. Funny and sad at the times had me on a rollercoaster of emotions.

comentarios: This game pulls at your emotions as well as any other visual novel.  Even know it lacks in choice (Not counting the options menu) it is not said to need it being a novel.  This is a good way to make a story look the same to a mass which if was just text and no image everyone will  view the characters and such in their own way. I also normally have my text speed to a very high speed but I found  the game would stop at mid word or sentence to force me to take a stop or period allowing it to flow better and seem  more real. Other then that the door bell ringing easily changed the direction of the chat for latter and kept the game  from dragging on. comentarios: The Cultural Revolution, formally the Great Proletarian Cultural Revolution, was a sociopolitical movement in China from 1966 until 1976. Launched by Mao Zedong, Chairman of the Communist Party of China (CPC), its stated goal was to preserve Chinese Communism by purging remnants of capitalist and traditional elements from Chinese society, and to re-impose Mao Zedong Thought (known outside China as Maoism) as the dominant ideology in the CPC. The Revolution marked Mao's return to the central position of power in China after a period of less radical leadership to recover from the failures of the Great Leap Forward, which contributed to the Great Chinese Famine only five years prior.

comentarios: It’s been a while since I played a visual novel, and unexpectedly this became a reminder of why I like them. Nekopara is dubious to say the least, as it’s a story about a man getting sexually involved with cat girls.  This is designed to provide relief from the horrible reality of every day life. The world of Nekopara is bright, pure, and uncomplicated. It’s full of love and hope. Whatever happens in the world, it’s never sinister, never dark. The most dramatic thing that happens is people getting sick. And because the stakes are so low, it manages to get some drama out of everyday events. The world doesn’t go under, nobody is hurt, nobody dies.   It delivers exactly what it says on the box. Definitely not for everyone. Can’t deny I found it pleasant, and it made me want to play more visual novels. Not because I crave more cat girls in my life. I just enjoy the process of playing them. Because you click to get the next line of text, you feel in control of the pace. Nothing punishes you for wanting to take it slow, or if you blaze through a scene. Unlike games the story doesn’t go on break. Every click advances the plot. Visual novels are their own thing, separate from games, film, books or comics. I like their mechanics, and the possibilities they provide for telling stories in ways which blur the line between mediums.  Nekopara doesn’t try to do much. But for what it is, it’s well put together. It’s enough to make me excited about playing other titles with more ambitious stories. And that’s enough for me to not harbor any negative feelings toward the title. I’m glad Steam has become a place where both this and Hatred can co-exist.

comentarios: Distilled catgirl cuteness!  PROS: This is a rather basic kinetic visual novel, but it plays to it's strength.  The story is coherent and straightforward, and though no end goal is given through the novel, it's the kind of story that doesn't need one.  It's fluff, cutesy and adorable with some emotional substance provided for the characters.  The art is fairly standard, as is the soundtrack, but I did enjoy the main theme, 'Taiyou Paradise.'  CONS: It is a rather basic kinetic visual novel, so the lack of choices may turn a few people off.  Having to pay extra for any sort of H-material seems to be grasping for a bit of extra cash, and feels a little odd.  A key bother, though, is the moving characters during the novel.  The way they dart about has an uncanny valley effect, and just comes off a bit stiff and unnatural at times.  The addition of a 'bounce' feature feels equally confusing.  ACHIEVEMENTS: Another visual novel that really only requires story progression.  Thanks to the style, most will be unlocked with one pass, though a quick start with the languages to round it off.  FINAL: This was a rather adorable experience that one can find enjoyment in, H-scenes or SFW.  It does feel like just adorable fluff in VN form, but it's the type of quick break that was enjoyed over the period of time played, and does leave a positive feeling for the later games to hopefully continue the story in the same charming, adorable light.

comentarios: This is an A+ example of a game that focuses entirely on fan service to the detriment of having anything of substance.  The setting makes no sense whatsoever. Catgirl biology makes no sense whatsoever (and whatever CAN make sense is completely counter-intuitive). Culture with catgirls makes no sense whatsoever.  Nothing works. It's something you have to completely shut your brain off to be able to enjoy because otherwise the fact that nothing makes any sense will completely ruin it.  It is also worth mentioning that I've played games that were far worse in the fan service department that still put a lot of effort into making everything as sensical as possible. It's very disappointing to see a game like this have some potential to be interesting and just bungle it this badly.  (To explain the playcount, I played this off of steam. I only bought it for the achievements.)

comentarios: [h1] NEKOPARA: Catnip for the Curious, and Well... More! [/h1] Welcome to the whimsical world of NEKOPARA, where catgirls reign supreme, and the plot takes a backseat to, well, some purr-plexing assets! 🐾  If you're in it for the feline-friendly fun, this visual novel will have you questioning whether you're a true cat lover or simply an enthusiast of...round shapes. Yes, we're talking about the NEKOPARA characters' ample assets. The creators have clearly decided that the cats in this game got more than their fair share of milk because, seriously, those proportions are nothing short of awe-inspiring.  The catgirls themselves are a sight to behold, and not just because of their adorable ears and tails. NEKOPARA boldly goes where few cat-based stories have gone before, putting the 'ecchi' in 'meowchii.' The bouncy physics of certain anatomical features could easily rival a trampoline park – talk about defying the laws of gravity with a furry twist!  The narrative is like the catnip that keeps you coming back for more, weaving a tale of patisseries, sisterly love, and a generous helping of double entendres. But let's be honest, the real stars of the show are the characters'...umm, personalities. They're just so well-rounded!  So, if you're looking for a game that embraces the philosophy of "plot over plot," and you have a penchant for catgirls with, shall we say, impressive assets, then NEKOPARA might just be the purr-fect match for you. Get ready for a tail-twitching, head-turning adventure that's bound to leave you feline fine! 🐱✨

comentarios: Been watching NEKOPARA again recently in preparation for vol 3, so thought I'd give my reviews an update too.  NEKOPARA was the first visual novel I tried reading, and it's still the best I've read. What its story lacks in choices, it makes up for in a story with excellent characters and actual depth, which I personally find is lacking in most VNs. Though to be frank, the people who read VNs for the story is probably less than the ones... you get the idea :) Anyways, most of the characters (<3 to Chocola, lol :D) are amusingly quirky, the plot has some great twists to it, and it has a really solid ending - most VN's I've read tend to kind of flop at the end tbh.  A more than solid 10/10. Here's hoping the OVA is as good :) (Only thing I've ever supported via Kickstarter, so it better be, lol)  As a side note, ignore the playtime. I've put far more hours into this than it says, lol. Had to start running it off steam because they made a mess of things and trying to run it with the adult patch installed now makes the game go up the spanner >.>

comentarios: Perhaps, a bit to my surprise, but... This game turned out to be quite good.   The story itself, while simple, is enjoyable. It's silly, it's fun, it's told well, and it does the job.  More unexpectedly, though has been just how well the unvierse has been set up. From quite early on, we know how this game's interpretation of catgirls operates, their limitations, how the world they live in interacts with them, and how they integrate into society. The biggest surprise has been, though, that there have been a number of hints of some particularly dark undertones to things going on within the world of this game, many dealing with the consequences of human actions.   I'm looking forward to more, whenever that happens to drop.   P.S. Vanilla is best catgirl n_n

comentarios: How to make Vanilla Cake  INGREDIENTS 1 1/2 c. sifted cake flour 1 1/2 tsp. baking powder 1/4 tsp. salt 1/2 c. unsalted butter 1 c. sugar 2 large eggs 1/2 tsp. vanilla extract 1/2 c. whole milk   INSTRUCTIONS Heat the oven to 400 degrees F. Lightly coat an 8-inch cake pan with butter and dust with all-purpose flour. Sift the cake flour, baking powder, and salt into a large mixing bowl. Beat in the butter one heaping 1/4 teaspoonful at a time, using an electric mixer set on low speed, until the mixture resembles coarse sand. Beat in the sugar a tablespoon at a time, until the mixture resembles fine damp sand. Beat in the eggs one at a time. Add the vanilla and milk, and beat on medium-high, just until blended. Do not overbeat. Pour into the prepared pan and bake until a wooden skewer inserted in the center comes out clean—30 to 35 minutes. Cool cake in the pan on a wire rack for 5 minutes. Un-mold and cool completely. Ice with Browned-Butter Glaze.

comentarios: I don't like leaving negative reviews but I feel like I have to for this one. Strap in, It's a frustrated one.  For those who don't want to read the whole thing, I can summarise this [strike] game [/strike] Visual novel (Seriously, why does it not have the tag visual novel (as a main tag)):  [h1] Shallow [/h1]   I will be honest and say I don't like visual novels in general, so you might ask me why would I even bother buying this? Well, It was and still is popular and well liked, I did really like ddlc, and I like erotic material. I figured when seeing it in a bundled sale of all volumes that I might like it and perhaps that it could even change my mind on visual novels. REST ASSURED, It reinforced my aversion.  [h3] The good [/h3] - The voice actresses are good from what I can tell, but I don't speak Japanese so take that as you will. - I like the art. It's well made apart from 2 nitpicks that I will mention later.  [h3] The bad (not 18+) [/h3] - The story is so shallow. I guess the best way to describe the story is interpersonal relationships between the protagonist and the catgirls + sister. That is all. What does this mean for the story? Well, it means that there is practically nothing going on. When the story works up to something, the chapter ends and the goal has been achieved off screen. Phenomenal. - It's a visual novel, I know, but it should still be mentioned: there is 0 interactibility. None. Forget replay value, there isn't even ANY playing. - Any shallow or minimal conflict there is, will be resolved within max. 10 sentences. - The book is about 6-7 hours on auto-play (with 18+). Considering there is no reason to replay this or the fact that it is just reading, €9,75 is quite a lot to ask. SIKE, to get this full time you need the 18+ patch which costs ANOTHER €9,75 for a total of €19,50. - The story doesn't respect your time. What is told, could be done in 3 hours probably. - The MC is a dolt, I dislike him. - I know this is a nitpick, but hear me out. One of the painted backgrounds, the one that shows the front of the store, has an opening sign that states: 'opem'. There aren't many backgrounds, it's a simple word, the only focus for this product is writing, the art, and voice acting. Frankly, there is no reason to have such a basic mistake. - 90%+ of the story is just happy go lucky. (Maybe somewhat individual criticism, but it feels off)  [h3] The bad (18+) [/h3] - I hope you like bleeding eardrums, because that is the main 18+ experience. The exceptionally whiny and earpiercing 'wails' will drive you up a wall. Lowering your volume won't help due to the high pitch of the voice actresses. - From what I understand the dialogue is very much Japanese style... They want it but still will say stop, no and stuff... yuck. - Something that has always bothered me about hentai, let's describe literally everything in excruciating detail. They just don't know when to shut up. - I hope you like censoring. The good animated scenes are utterly worthless as a result, you can't even see anything (apart from nips). Honestly, just look up the 6 gifs online, it might even be a better experience. - I hope you like repeating sentences that are only minimally altered. (x4) - The official patch for the 18+ material is another €9,75! Are you out of your mind? To be honest, it's somewhat my mistake to think it was included. Yes, the game is practically known for the funneh 18+ stuff but let it be known, it costs extra.  [h1] To conclude [/h1]  I feel like my review was more articulate than the slideshow I paid for. Keep your money, it isn't worth the sweet catgirl tiddies.  There are enough of those and 100x better quality online for free.

comentarios: The drawing and animation is insanely good, (probably the best I have seen in a game), as is the voice acting.   However I do have 2 big gripes with it. If I spoke fluent japanese, this would not be a con. The other con is that, I expected there to be some  (ANY AT ALL!) level of choice in this 'game'. You just click the text box, and it opens the next text box. If there are no choices in a 'game' like this, what exactly is the difference between this and a softcore hentai movie? I take issue with anything sold on steam where you have zero input on what happens. Classifying it as an indie game is bad.

comentarios: This recommendation comes with HUGE caveats, especially if the game is not on sale at the moment which you decide to buy it. I honestly don't believe the users should be tagging this with "visual novel", as that implies some sort of player interactivity. This should be referred to as a "kinetic novel", which basically means "just point and click through the dialogue and enjoy the story".  Pros: -The art is bright and cheerful ( I love the cell style coloring). -The animations are more than just a simple fade between two static frames. They are smooth and very much like watching an anime. -Instant fan service/gratification -Super cute, tug-on-your-heartstrings cat girls -The addition of super cute voice acting -Bouncy you-know-what slider  Cons: -The story is nothing to get excited about. Even with how short it is, there was ample opportunity to not go the typical route, but sadly at no point is it unpredictable. -Characters are also very typical. You have the holy trinity of fan service: Super cute, overly excited girl, super shy, reserved girl,  and doting protagonist who just happens to have this all fall into his lap. -The emote system while smoother and providing nice animations as mentioned above, are not really "countless" as suggested in the games description. There are four main poses that get used throughout the majority of the game. -No replay value. Except for that...maybe...  All in all, I'd suggest it as a guilty pleasure. There isn't a lot of depth, but it is fun. Enjoy the fan service!

comentarios: Japan holds technology capable of breeding a race of humanoids who reach maturity in about a year. In most cases, this would lead to an army of easily and quickly replacable samurai assault troops with the capacity to conquer, say, the South China Sea. In this case, however, we take a sharp left through a brick wall and create a race of adorable, female only, human-feline hybrids, whom cannot produce offspring with humans and have no logical means of maintaining population, and are also quite dim-witted. World conquest grows ever farther, but cuddles and fucks aplenty here.  Nekopara is a kinetic novel about a guy/possible robot who finds family and companionship with his ever loyal twin catgirls. Yep, that about sums the plot up. That said, the animation is pretty amazing, with characters that sway and blink and whatnot, appearing quite lively compared to most VNs I've seen. I was quite taken by the animation, and the catgirls are endearing characters, although I sure as hell wouldn't want a real one. Overall, I'd recommend it, especially if its on sale.

comentarios: Protip: Get the 18+ DLC  Jokes aside, Nekopara is more of a visual novel than a game, where the player only needs to click the mouse (mostly with his left hand) to advance the story. comentarios: A simple, fun kinetic novel. You don't really play it but instead watch and enjoy at your own pace. So sweet that it will give you diabeetus. Barebones story but colourful art and refreshing non-static graphics.  I personally spoke aloud the protagonist's spoken dialogue which made it a lot more immersive as the character's really felt like they were responding. You have to make your own fun for content like this. Was also fun to stream it in this way.  If you like 3 lumps of sugar in your tea and cute anime catgirls then by all means give this a go.

comentarios: To even call this a game is a stretch, its basically a visual novel on your PC.  The plot is so boring, even with the constant hints at incest between the main character and his younger sister and the lolicon background plot between Chocola and Vanilla.  I got this game as a gift, and was kinda eager to play it mostly because I thought there would be SOME gameplay. It's all story and basically two hours of clicking through text before the credits roll. $10 is so overpriced for what you get, and if youre hoping for nudity- there is none. one bath scene with censorship throughout the entire game. Dissapointed, not because of the lack of nudity or fan-service, but because all these reviews just give too much credit to this "game".

comentarios: I really enjoyed this kinetic novel, I been on a VN kick and got this on sale. While it is disapointing there is no options in this version of it (though hear that will be different in volume 2 so yay) the characters and story is cute, the voice acting is nice (though I understood none of it since I only speak English). It takes several hours to read but it does a good job telling you how the world works, the art is great and the fact that the faces don't just change but they move (even just a little bit) is really nice to see. Hope to see routes in volume 2, because I really enjoyed this story and the characters and cant wait to see more.

comentarios: This game is absolutely horrendous. Pretty much any visual novel can be expected to be fetishistic an stereotypical, but this is a fine example of these issues. There are numerous instances where the dialogue suddenly feels extremely stilted because some sexual implication is brought up out of nowhere, and especially when mentioned by one of the more innocent characters, these jokes and impications feel extremely out of place. Obviously it's an ecchi/18+ game, but you shouldn't have to throw innuendos into every single conversation like that. Literally a moments thought about this universe's logic reveals how actually fucked up it is. I mean, you essentially OWN other human beings - or at the very least, sentient beings who are shown to be pretty much equally capable to humans given the right environment. There's also the extremely obvious incestuous obsession of the MC's younger sister, which by the way, they do no efforts to excuse, even specifically stating that she is A. blood related and B. quite a bit younger than the MC in another game. An speaking of age gaps, did i mention that Vanilla and Chocola are cannonically NINE MONTHS OLD? They also act basically like children, and it's clear from the dialogue that they have only recently reached sexual maturity, so they are probably 16 year-olds in human years AT BEST. In addition, MC also raised them and is said to veiw them like younger sisters. Literally how much creepier can you get? Oh right, they are also legally his possesions. EW. So yeah, this game is absolutely the worst I have ever, EVER played.  That being said, they are all incredibly cute and god i want their wardrobes so bad. This series is probably my guiltiest pleasure ever.  nyanyanya nya nyanya nnya nyan nya nyannyanyan nyan nyan nya nyanya! nyanyanya nya nyanyanaynya!!! NYANYANYA!! :3

comentarios: First and foremost, this game is strictly 18+ so the rest of the review will assume you are aware of that fact and are ok with it  Nekopara Vol. 1 is a simple Visual Novel where you follow the adventures of kashou and his attempts to make his living running a bakery, but there's a surprise in store for him once he starts unboxing in his new home 2 Catgirls, Chocola and Vanilla   The story itself is good enough, I give it a 3.5/5 character development is poor but it has plenty of humor combine with serious moments  But I'm sure if you're looking to buy this game it's for the 18+ content There is a patch avalible on the internet (I just googled Nekopara 1 patch and it was the first result) It add explicit sexual scenes into the game at certain points, they involve the main character(you) having sex with the 2 mentioned cargirls so if you want to play the game with the patches I suggest playing at night, and always be ready to switch to something more normal, like pornhub  The artwork is pretty nice, a solid 4.5/5 for me, I would of liked something that involved a couple of darker colors as well as the light ones common through the game, but that's just a personal preference  In Summary, if you want something only cost a couple bucks and you can use for fapping then this is a easy choice, though I beg you to keep the volume down at certain parts

comentarios: There are only 3 ways to get this "game".   1.) You like Catgirls and buy this game. 2.) You are a perv and buy this game.  3.) You get this game gifted and cannot decline (like in my case)   Now, im not gonna lie, this game is all about... Catgirls! Surprising, right? Long story short:  Its a Visual Novel about a character (you) moving away from his family to open his own bakery and get things done.  Unfortunately (unfortunately?) 2 old acquaintances of you get "delivered" to you. Chocolate & Vanilla, 2 very charming Catgirls.  Unfortunately (unfortunately?) you can't get rid of them so you have to live with them together in your flat.  Thats the start of this incredible journey.   The visuals are top notch, the dialog is acceptable and the fan service is great. (even better once you get your hands on the uncens... i mean, advanced version... so i've heard)  One small thing to add from my side: Don't play this when relatives are around, don't play this while being online, under no circumstances point out that you own it / play it / like it and ... don't forget to patch before you play.  Rating it 10/10. As a visual novel - good! As a game, trying to please the specific audience - great!

I personally didn't utilize it more than a few times, but you can press "p" and see the characters on screen show off the "physics engine". It's full of cute scenes as well as a tiny bit of drama (nothing crazy though). I would recommend this visual novel to anyone who just wants a comfy relaxing read, or who has a predilection for catgirls in particular.

comentarios: Ewan McGregor really helped sell the emotion of the movie, acting phenomenally considering that a majority of his co-stars were CGI stuffed animals. As the movie progresses, his character becomes less and less serious and more playful, and McGregor pulls this transition off phenomenally, being both funny and believable. Many actors, specifically comedy actors, would have overdone this transition, making their funny moments over the top just to get a laugh. McGregor still managed to get a laugh, humorously yet believably becoming more like Pooh as the movie progressed in a natural, yet still entertaining manner.  While the return of all of the animal characters was fantastic, Pooh truly stood out as the star of the show. Eeyore's self loathing, Piglet's anxiety, and Tigger's pride with his uniqueness certainly added their own factors to the mix, but Pooh still stood out. This movie reminded audiences of why Winnie the Pooh was such a great character to begin with: he represents everything good in this world. He teaches us to appreciate the little things and to take the time to appreciate what you have.   The genius part of Christopher Robin is that, when the movie actually started, Christopher Robin and Winnie the Pooh were polar opposites. This was an incredibly clever way to start the story, as in all of the previous Winnie the Pooh stories, Christopher Robin and Pooh were almost always on the same page. This change to Christopher Robin's character added a new twist to the movie that would certainly be relatable for any adults who watched Winnie the Pooh as a kid. This entire piece of character development was a clever writing twist that certainly helped to keep the movie incredibly interesting.  Another factor that kept the movie interesting and visually entertaining was the color scheme. While the trailers showed that it would have a desaturated look, the finished product itself had a gorgeous red tint to it. It made the sunset scenes in Hundred Acre Wood absolutely beautiful, turning the classic scenes from the cartoons and books into an even more gorgeous piece of imagery.  All things considered, the latest live-action movie from Walt Disney Pictures is a truly heartwarming experience that any Disney fan is sure to enjoy. The return of the classic characters, and the in-depth development from Christopher Robin, portrayed by Ewan McGregor, made the movie enjoyable and touching. Though it may not bring in the big bucks like Beauty and the Beast did, Christopher Robin is still a great success from Disney and stands out from the rest of their live-action movies.

comentarios: Less like a true visual novel in the sense that MC doesn't get any choices. However, this game has some of the best graphics I've seen from a visual novel, while it still being accessible in price. I do prefer the all ages version. H-scenes are quality (if you're into that) but they can be a bit ... much. Only got the DLC out of curiosity and for reviewing purposes. Overall, I really did enjoy it and recommend it. It's lighthearted and comforting to me, as I've been following the games for years and just now finally got to play it <3

comentarios: NEKOPARA is not only a game, you need to think it as book that sucks you inside it once you start, and after that returning to normal life is really depressing and just like CIV, NEKOPARA makes you *play one more dialogue*.  The story is deeper than in Game of Thrones and the characters grow and change as the story goes forward. The game doesnt give you any chooses, but its made so well you dont really need them.   After buying NEKOPARA my life has doubled its value, even tho Ive lost some of my friends and my parents dont look to me the same way they used to before buying NEKOPARA, I still say it is worth it.  When im feeling really down, I turn NEKOPARA on and start new fresh save, and I instantly feel better about myself. Because in this world of cute cat girls, I feel immortal. There is nothing that can harm me, or my precious cat girls.  NEKOPARA truly is Cat Paradise.

comentarios: This game CHANGED MY LIFE. After my wife left me there was a hole in my heart I didn't think I could ever fill again. I was no longer able to find joy in games, so when I first started up this game I wasn't expecting to be so emotionally captivated by a maid cafe story.  I was wrong. The first time I met eyes with Chocola, something moved deep inside me. We instantly clicked... She laughed at my jokes, she liked talking to me... Sure enough, we quickly fell in love with each other. Never before have I seen the raw emotion of true love emulated so purely. But what surprised me is that Vanilla also began displaying affection to me and she won over my heart as well. What can I say, I guess I'm just too much of a hunk! Keep playing and you might get as good as me.  The animation really makes them seem alive. I keep instinctually reaching out to the screen to pet them. The art is not only very cute, but the characters are extremely realistic and believable and you really feel connected to the characters. It's even better than talking to humans. Before this game I had no one. Now I have not one, but TWO cat wives who love me! Who needs anyone else when these beautiful ladies love you unconditionally?  Even better is the immersive programming. The characters always seem to follow my eyes, and whisper my name at night. I can't figure out how you guys programmed that! Great job though.  The game is so good that I'm never going to stop playing. I'm finally happy again. THANK YOU NEKO WORKS!!!

comentarios: [h1]Well, NEKOPARA vol.1[/h1] When first time I ran NEKOPARA, my mind was almost at my cuteness and kawaiiness limits :3 Those Nekos are amazing. Never seen such adorable and vivid kawaii characters before. I love all of them. They are completely adorable.  [h1]Characters[/h1] [olist] [*][url=https://youtu.be/yH4R0MwExvo][b]Azuki[/b][/url]. Aaah, my favorite one. She has me to crush on her with that frolic character and sarcastic enjoyable quips, always on a perky mischievous mood, more likely [i]tsundere[/i] character. Don't get me wrong and pls stop calling the cops - she's the eldest Minaduki neko! Also her responsibility and tender insides just makes me thrill. Guess I like her bluntness + shyness on the other side pretty much. She's a [i]Munchkin[/i] neko.  [*][url=https://youtu.be/ZmIqFqnMj60][b]Vanilla[/b][/url]. Well, she's also one of my favorites. With that corteous behaivor, cold and mysterious look in her eyes, sharp piercing phrases, calm and reserved barely recognizable emotions, rare soft and genuine tenderness - all that kindly teasing stuff makes [b]Vanilla[/b] truly catching one. Oh [b]Vanilla[/b]'s really makes my mind melt. She's more [i]kuudere[/i] than [i]dandere[/i] character to me.  [*][url=https://youtu.be/MWDFRIL7LoQ][b]Chocola[/b][/url]. [spoiler]Eheh, that's where the verge of crime becomes barely visible[/spoiler]. I like Chocola, her energetic mood always cheers me up, she's a really adorable one. A happy-go-lucky neko, I'm in love with her sincerity. Her innocent and genuine elated character, truly optimistic, sparkling eyes, exciting cute voice - all of it makes Chocola really really great. Truly, genki + moe char. [*][url=https://youtu.be/isJEI88_ZgI][b]Coconut[/b][/url]. Oh my, she's the best. She's quite different from the other nekos. Tall, athletic, smart, doing some martial arts. Even she's young, you can suppose like she's the elder one. Confident and cool, she's really modest and kindhearted from the inside. As she says about herself: [i]"...I think I'd rather be a cute catgirl than a cool one"[/i]. Also she's little bit shy, has some issues with low self-esteem and jelaous to other catgirls for their appearances. But for me, she's more than just good. She's gorgeous. Btw I really enjoy huge cute&clumsy shy girls too. She's a [i]Maine Coon[/i] neko [*][url=https://youtu.be/qVmrIZTE06U][b]Maple[/b][/url], kind, proud and also vigorous and extrovertous neko. She's quite a young lady. Sophisticated in some way. Well, trying to show that all the time - how be perfect and versatile. She's an [i]American Curl[/i] neko. [*][url=https://youtu.be/ccIkbzFxwjc][b]Cinnamon[/b][/url], kinda perverted Neko, maybe too much. Cinnamon makes me feel really awkward sometimes with her lewd and lecherous polysemantic phrases, but she's rather nice in her own special way. She's tender, even voluptuous character. [spoiler]Never liked overweighted melons though :D[/spoiler] So, I guess it's just a common moe character. She's a [i]Scottish Fold[/i] neko. [/olist]  [b]Kashou[/b]. Don't think that I might be able to say much about him, but, well, he's ambitious,  responsible, polite and most likely collective character, reasonable and collective in order to be compared to the player. Typical [i]"nice guy"[/i], he's the one the catgirls surely can rely on. [spoiler]Also, sometimes he's quite dumbass[/spoiler] To be honest, i like him anyway. I guess I should mention one more character, [url=https://youtu.be/WgJM99I_IAw][b]Shigure[/b][/url], [b]Kashou[/b]'s younger sister. To tell you the truth, she's not the person who can actually make you feel something more than common character interest. Not really catching. I guess the very plot needs her in order to be more logical and sense-making, to make whole story cohergent.   [h1]Graphics[/h1] [b][url=https://youtu.be/TQudvxDriz4?t=13m14s][quote=Noble, 2014]THE MOVE! THE MOVE! OH GOD! OH!! HOLY SHI~, THEY MOVE! THEY BLINK! OH GOD! OH MY GOD! THIS IS THE BEST THING EVER[/quote][/url][/b] [url=https://youtu.be/TQudvxDriz4?t=13m49s][b][quote=Noble, 2014]DID YOU SEE THAT THEY F*CKING BOUNCE?? MMM~! MY GOD, THEY F*CKING BOUNCE[/quote][/b][/url] My god, Noble's damn right, developers made them moving, using E-mote technology, and now the characters are no longer the static sprites or smth, they are quite active during the game process. That is surely the completely new level of a visual novel gams to me. Spectacular! [spoiler]THEY ACTUALLY BOUNCE! BOINGBOINGBOING[/spoiler] [spoiler]P is my favorite button now. Definetly.[/spoiler]  [h1]Voicing[/h1] Ah, the voices...mmm. In addition to E-mote technolgy of animation, each one of the characters, except protagonist, have their own voices! That is really niiiice! The actual seiyus done great piece of work! Well, that's really looks awesome, making them even more charismatic, catching and loveable. Because of highly developed anime voicing industry in Japan, all those characters are greatly sparkling and outstanding, I am really enjoying their different personalities. [spoiler]Aaand...in R-18 cutscenes the voice is actually doing about half of the work, ya know ;)[/spoiler]  [h1]Plot[/h1] Well you all should know the plot, it's simple and consistent, just th way it should be in such game. Well, I wish I could have had more influence to the game process like choices or smth, but whatever.  [quote=Wiki]Kashou Minaduki is an aspiring chef who moves away from home to open his own confection shop. While he is unpacking in his new shop, he discovers that two of his family's Nekos, Chocola and Vanilla, came along with him by hiding in cardboard boxes. After the two Nekos convince Kashou to let them stay and live with him, the three of them work together to run his shop, "La Soleil". Throughout the story, Kashou is frequently visited by his younger sister Shigure, as well as the other Nekos owned by his family.[/quote]  [h1]P.S.[/h1] [b][url=https://youtu.be/TQudvxDriz4?t=8m03s][quote=Noble, 2014]You know what? I don't care where we are in, this is HEAVEN. This is got to be Heaven[/quote][/url][/b] [b][url=https://youtu.be/TQudvxDriz4?t=9m23s][quote=Noble, 2014] OH GOD.  Every fetish... EVERY FETISH I HAVE EVER HAD... IN THIS GAME WE DOING RIGHT NOW![/quote][/url][/b] [h1]P.P.S.[/h1] [spoiler]Don't get me wrong, but there are also animated R-18 cutscenes. TOTALLY ENJOYABLE[/spoiler] [spoiler][url=http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=YGw5-rUdeXA]Why do you need real women after this?[/url][/spoiler]  In conclusion, I wanna make-up some rates. Well.  [table]     [tr]         [th]Characters[/th]         [td]9.2[/td]     [/tr]     [tr]         [th]Graphics[/th]         [td]10[/td]     [/tr]     [tr]         [th]Plot[/th]         [td]7.8[/td]     [/tr]     [tr]         [th]Boobiness[/th]         [td]10[/td]     [/tr]  [tr]         [th]Voicing[/th]         [td]10[/td]     [/tr]     [tr]         [th]Playability[/th]         [td]8.3[/td]     [/tr]     [tr]         [th]Total[/th]         [td]9.21[/td]     [/tr]

comentarios: Story - 0/5 Characters - 0/5 - too much sugar, no soul Atmosphere - 0/5  Nekopara is a light novel or visual novel, I don't really know what is this genre of vg called. Anyways... It may seem like a good purchase, because it seems cute and the characters move and make gestures when you are talking to them, but that is about everything you are going to get. The whole game consists of monotone clicking and reading what the flat and mostly annoying characters say (+ what you, the main guy, thinks). Game has no plot and you can prepare for the many anime harem cliches like a young boy living alone, being kind yet stupid to realize every single girl (including his own sis, maybe) is in love with him, hard and sad past of the girls, which is not that hard nor sad at all.   This game is telling you that you are going to get a lot of anime cuteness and a romantic story. But prepare to get none of those. Instead of that prepare for hours of boring reading what "you" think about your very little intligent girlfriends. (yap, polygamy with people with minds of a cat is actually legal in this game)  Some new harem animes thesedays at least try to focus on the true main characters (the girls) but this game does not do even that.  One plus to the voice actresses who actually represented the characters very good. (yet they were still very annoying)  I juts want to add, at the time of writing this I was a big anime fan... so this is not a hate on anime or japanese pop culture. This game is simply not good.
