comentarios: [b]November 25th, 2021[/b]  "I guess now that we've come full circle, I should get you Volume 1 for the complete set, right?"  Again, I cannot verify that this was exactly what was said, but rather, an approximation. Another friend of mine that watched me read through Volumes 2, 3, and 4 was eagerly waiting in anticipation for my read-through of Volume 1, so he said something along these lines. A different friend had picked up the demo for this game, and I watched him go through this time (albeit only for a little bit, as I played through Volume 1 a bit later).  I was ready for a well deserved break following the rare strain of cringe that was Volume 4. Of course, that break didn't last very long. I was ready to get back into this series once again, but this time I took a little detour before getting back into the Visual Novels. I had discovered that there was not one, but MULTIPLE anime adaptations, the most prominent of which was by Funimation and not some rinky-dink backwater studio. I realized now that what I was dealing with was way bigger than I had initially thought, and was not just some niche indie project that had a small following. This series has sold 5 MILLION copies across 6 games, which blew my initial estimates out of the fucking water.  I watched the first few episodes of the Funimation anime (I eventually did finish it), and my expectations for how much I could cringe at a piece of media were proverbially flattened by an imaginary steamroller disguising itself as anime (I don't really care too much about anime as a genre one way or the other, but I can now see why some call it a 'mistake'). I knew I needed some more preparation before I could face this series again, so I decided to go with something more "tame" and watched the OVA.  However, when I watched the OVA, I noticed that the beginning was very similar to the demo of Volume 1 that my friend had played just days prior. I had now mistakenly obtained most of the knowledge I would've received from Volume 1 by watching an OVA that was one-fifth as long. The problem with this is that now I essentially had no reason to sit through Volume 1, making my experience with this game a particularly boring one.  But before I go into my actual thoughts on Volume 1 as a game, let's string off into yet another aspect of the series that spans more than just the volume in question. Now that I have exhausted the "gameplay", music, and main characters, lets talk about something more juicy that relates to the knowledge that this specific volume gifts you; (*cue fanfare*) the ethics of catgirls!   After my experience with Volume 2, I needed to know a few things about this universe, and most key among them were "What are catgirls anyway? Have they always been here? Were they engineered somehow? What sort of genetic makeup are we looking at here? Do humans reproduce with cat-people?"  I'm happy to report that finally, after 3 games and zero answers, Volume 1 has finally given me what I was looking for. (I know I could've started at the beginning and found this out a lot sooner, but don't forget that I wasn't originally expecting to play through the entire series)  What I am less happy to report, however, is what the answer actually is. I can sum it up for you in 4 words, taken from the actual game (yes, I did open it again for this review in order to check).  "genetically modified humanoid cats"  At first, genetically modifying cats sounds pretty bad, in my opinion. However, consider the alternative: "genetically modified catlike humans" instantly becomes way worse than modified cats, because that would involve some form of human genetic experimentation, possibly on live subjects, which is certainly not something one should be thinking of while one of the results of these experiments is loudly asking the main character about menstrual pads in public. However, this means that cat-people were [b]created[/b] to be human-like, but beneath humanity as a sub-class of citizen, which is a tragic tale when put in that context.  But now, there comes a new dilemma: what if instead of animal experimentation they instead decided to trace the origin story to cat-people that evolved naturally? Well that opens a new can of worms in the game's universe, since if you remember my volume 2 review, I discussed that the society is set up very similar to a slave society, with catgirls legally unable to do anything independently (a situation that is relevant in Volume 1, surprisingly). So now, the human race essentially has enslaved parts of themselves and cast one race on top of another as the "owners" while independence of the lower caste is illegal, and I don't think I need to explain why that's bad.  That leaves us between a rock and a hard place in how to approach the origins of catgirls. Either they were created in a lab with animal experimentation with the expressed purpose of creating a new pet with human features (often to used to fulfill some kind of sexual fantasy), stripping them of rights that would ordinarily be granted to humans (and since it is revealed that catgirls were typically homeless strays until recently, neglected by the very experiment that brought them into existence), [i]OR[/i], there is a forceful enslavement of humans over cat-people, dehumanizing them and restricting their independence until they are little more than common pets. Nekopara has elected to adopt the first option as the canonical origin story, but both of these options are questionable, neither of which, in my opinion, take a clear moral high ground over the other.   But enough of my silly rant, let's examine the game now, shall we.  As I mentioned earlier, I had seen the OVA before playing Volume 1, so I already knew what was going to happen, and the experience was relatively boring compared to going in without previous knowledge. However, even in isolation of this fact, Volume 1 is easily the weakest of the main Nekopara series (I say 'main' because there is a worse entry with the "Nekopara" name). The story was the least interesting, largely settling into generic misadventures with Chocola and Vanilla, with occasional references to their backstory and strong attachment to Kashou, which largely feel shoehorned in and contrast poorly with the rest of the story. The only part I'd call passable is the ending, when the catgirls commit a felony by leaving the house without bells, and even then it wasn't very good. I largely feel this was done poorly because Chocola and Vanilla are not well written characters in Volume 1. They lack little human characteristics to make them feel real, which I guess was kind of the point in making them cats. However, later games in the series take more and more gradual steps to make the catgirls feel more human, which makes for more interesting stories later down the line. Even Chocola and Vanilla receive some of these characteristics in later entries (and even the anime, to an extent), and that ultimately improves the quality of these characters. Their characters in Volume 1, however, boil down to little more than "I wuv master uwu cuz he took care of me when I was sick :3 and i wanna have sexy time with him~". I wish there was more to it than that, but other than that, their characters are literally no different than an actual cat; acting on their instincts with 0 regard for those around them, a characteristic even a side character catgirl (who came back in volume 2 renamed "Milk") is better at hiding than these two.  I was unimpressed by Volume 1, and had I started here the proper way instead of looping around via later games I'd likely be unmotivated to continue. However, in this game I received answers to many (but not all) of my questions that had been lingering since I started with Volume 2, which I consider both a blessing and a curse thanks to this. My journey is still not over, but the end is in sight.  tl;dr: nya nya catgirl game 1 answers questions but is boring. watch OVA instead. 4/10

comentarios: Sometimes I hug my pillow and imagine I'm talking to Chocola for hours. I feel an inhuman sense of relation to this character I've projected my emotion and love onto due to my own fear and lack of companionship. The idea that I might have someone I could love in the way I love this fictional character is all that has kept me going and it's a horrible horrible reason that's perverted by my own selfish wants. I don't deserve someone like that and given what I've seen so far i don't think I'll ever find someone like that. My mental state has deteriorated over the past several years and my perception of reality is warped to the point where she literally feels real to me, her fluffy tail and her warm embrace feels so real which gave me both fear and comfort. Sometimes I listen to her voice saying: "There there don't you worry my lovely little boy, Chocola is here for you" while feeling her hands and tails wrapped around me. On December 9th, 2022, I'm going to take my medications and finally be removed from this schizophrenic hell that i'm slowly being sucked into.

(⁰ ◕〜◕ ⁰) Watashi imagined about half-way through the gameu nani if Yuno Gasai from Mirai Nikki came rushing in with Rena Ryuguu's axe from Higurashi no Naku koro ni to chop Vanilla in half Yandere-style. comentarios: Well, there're several steps you need to take before playing this game. 1. Buy it without any hesitation. 2. Close any applications which may take up the bandwidth of your network and download it with full speed.  3. Make sure that the doors and curtains of your room are tightly shut. 4. Set Steam Friend status to Offline. 5. Get a nice pair of headphone. 6. (Optional) Prepare a roll of tissue in case of need. 7. (Optional) If you are over 18 years old, you can also get yourself a physical/digital copy of 18X version, which may contain many...eh... enjoyable elements. 8. Get yourself seated and adjust your pose to a comfortable one. 9. Click Play button gently. Besides, if you have any trouble unlocking achievements, please visit forums for help.  Oh, and one more warning, DON'T EVEN THINK ABOUT TRYING ANYTHING IN THE GAME OUT IN THE REAL WORLD! Or... you'll regret that... (you know what I mean ^_^)  Strongly recommended! An Essential Purchase for anime lovers!

comentarios: I never really could get in to the Visual Novel genre despite trying on several occasions.  I played ones that were critically acclaimed and then I played Nekopara.  Though its debatable whether I would actually call this a "game", but to my surprise I found this to be rather fun.  I mean its stupid but its charming in its own way.  If you enjoy reading manga at all you can think of this as a visual comic, or depending on whether you install the adult patch, an H-manga.  Recommended though I wouldn't pay full price for it.  Wait for a sale with its 75% off if your interested.

Let's be honest, the storyline here is as realistic as any other porn plot, but this game is actually pretty to look at, and really does require headphones, however, at the same time, it doesn't require any pants or lotion, because by the time something *does* happen, you're dripping with "How are my cat girls going to give the owner a boner this time?" if that's not a plus, then I don't know what is.  The first time I played this, I didn't have the 18+ Patch on, and I still generally enjoyed it, so in my expert opinion, you can still have a good time without any of having to download the porn patch. By the *low* chance that you *will* download it (LOLOL WHO AM I KIDDING?!?), it does have some pretty graphic scenes (that move w/ bouncy boobies), that are seriously hard to explain to anyone in your family, or at least I assume it would be.

comentarios: Ok. This game is really good. Like, my top 5 games. The other 2 are also in the top 5. I can't describe  how good it is. I hate anime, but this game is good. Probably because the characters aren't two dimensional, except in the literal sense. They actually have traits and flaws unique to them. Just buy this game. Grahpics are really good.  The E-mote engine allows 3-d models that looks 2-d or something like that, since they can turn around and all that. The story is also pretty good. It is a VN, so there won't be any actual choices, but it's good nonetheless. There is technically no gameplay, but thats fine by me. I'm not a fan of VNs (or, I wasn't) or anything anime related, but buy this game. It's worth full price, but buy it on a sale if you don't want to spend $10.

comentarios: ok so first, I didn't go into this game thinking it was a porn game. I genuinely thought it was just a visual novel. So, I'll be reviewing it as one.   The Pros: the art, voice acting, and design of the game are put together very well. The art is super cute (besides the lewd stuff which is super nasty imo)   The Cons: HORRIBLE writing. Genuinely the characters are SO annoying, the worldbuilding makes no sense either. AND not to mention the incest shit?? You have a little sister who's obsessed with you AND you're like the father of the catgirls? But you have sex with them?? It's just so messed up. Gross sex shit aside, it's near impossible to actually play the game. I can't get over the oddly worried dialogue. It's so hard to read.   So in conclusion, if you're kinda weird and looking for a solid sex game, go for it I guess? But, if you're looking for an actual visual novel please stay away.   SUPER funny game to gift to a friend tho

comentarios: It is more than its thematic turbulence that makes NEKOPARA Vol. 1 extraordinary, actually. Excellence abounds at every turn in this open-world role-playing game: excellent exploration, excellent creature design, excellent combat mechanics, excellent character progression. But the moments that linger are those that reveal the deep ache in the world's inhabitants. In one quest, you reunite two lovers, one of which is now a rotting hag, its tongue lasciviously lolling from its mouth. In another, a corpulent spouse-abuser must find a way to love two different lost souls, each of which test the limits of his affection. Don't worry that these vague descriptions spoil important events: they are simple examples of the obstacles every resident faces. On the isles of Neko Paradise and back home with Shigure, there is no joy without parallel sorrow. Every triumph demands a sacrifice. Overall nice cheap porn - 9/11

comentarios: Being a pretty long-time fan of Sayoris (the artist) work, i bought this game together in a Bundle with the other Nekopara Games (excluding the newly released Part 4 and Nekopara Extra).  If you want the full experience, you will need to buy the R-18 contents for this game seperately because Steam does not allow 18+ content apparently. If you want the full Nekopara experience you pretty much need the DLC. The DLC includes multiple scenes for Vanilla and Chocola, the other girls come in later games.  The Story certainly isn't bad but if you came here for the Story alone, you should probably buy a different VN. Artwork looks gorgeous, especially the R18-Scenes which are animated, albeit only short looping clips. The voice acting seems pretty good too, at least judging by my limited japanese.  In conclusion this is a very good R18 VN (again, with the DLC), i recommend buying it together in the bundle with the rest of the series

comentarios: NEKOPARA is a visual novel set in Japan where they have biologically spliced human DNA into cats creating the abominations known as "Catgirls". These cat girls are humanoid looking with feline characteristics such as tails and cat ears on their head. The catgirls are intelligent beings capable of speaking human languages and complex thinking yet Japan permitted that people could own catgirls as human property, It is even socially acceptable to have a emotional and sexual relationship with catgirls. The Japanese society is running on what I would call a Pseudo-Sharia Law concerning the catgirls as they are not permitted to walk in public without a "bell" or the owner...

comentarios: I got this after hearing about it online. First, yes, it's ultimately *that* kind of game, so expect that kind of thing in here.  But what makes this worth the price to me - when I could easily find free stuff online - are the sheer depth of the characters. Chocola and Vanilla are absolutely *charming* in their portrayal, emphasized by the skill their respective actresses bring, and they both work wonderfully as natural compliments to each other, each of them making up for the other.  The story is also very charming in itself. Though it is a typical "harem"-style story with an inevitable conclusion, the writing helps bring it to life; Chocola confessing her sadness early on actually tore at me, and Vanilla's mischievous streak had me cackling at times. In this case, it is the journey itself that counts more then the destination, and the journey was enjoyable all the way through!  The supporting cast are also quite good, though a bit lacking in depth currently. Still, I know there's more volumes out there, so I'm sure they'll all get their own screen time.  My one complaint: the graphics are a bit...stiff. It sucks that only one character can seem to move at a time, which makes for some initially confusing moments. Fortunately, the writing is good enough that the confusion goes away quickly after moving to the next couple of sections, but it did detract a bit at times. There also seem to be a few glitches with the speech where you sometimes have to click twice to make the full text appear (a problem if you're not a natural Japanese speaker, as VO is only in Japanese).  Still, none of this was nearly enough to detract from my enjoyment, and I'm looking forward to trying the other volumes in Neokpara soon!  ...Oh, and for those who are new to Graphic Novels: this isn't really a "game", as there's no interactivity beyond what you might get out of an actual book (click to move on to the next sequence, bookmark your spot for later, etc). No mini-games or puzzles or other stuff like that. THIS IS NOT A BAD THING as it allows you to focus more on the store; just be prepared when you come in.

comentarios: Despite being one man, the developer of this game really knows what his fans want. On Friday, I had burned my hand with flaming oil and stayed eight straight hours in a neglectful "healthcare" facility that took eight hours to bandage my recently singed flesh. This left me with very limited use of my left hand, thus rendering me unable to play most games as they tend to require two hands. This hero of a developer kept his clientele in mind, and made it so this game could easily be played with one hand. I can tell just by that design choice that this is an upstanding Christian man who had developed a wholesome Christian game. Obviously this game was designed for people with limited mobility such as myself, as I cannot think of any other reason why this game should be played with one hand. These design choices lead me to believe that there is still hope left for humanity, 10/10.

comentarios: I'm replaying trough the Nekopara series for the second time now, and I felt like leaving a more elaborate review to anyone that might be interested in giving it a try.  [b] Nekopara Vol.1 [/b] is the first slice of a Visual Novel series about life with catgirls (and also running a patisserie). Each volume (game) moves the story forward and focuses on a different pair of catgirls, and this one is all about Chocola and Vanilla.  Reading trough the VN you can expect a very fun slice of life story, lovable and charismatic characters, amazing art with lively animated sprites, a great soundtrack, a lewd-cute romance and even optional NSFW content (included on the paid +18 dlc). If you enjoy any of this stuff, I recommend this VN for you!  Note that this is a linear VN, meaning that you don't have any dialogue or action options, and also meaning there's no character routes, so just sit back and enjoy the reading.  The story is divided into 8 chapters, and if I have to explain them, each one could be compared to an anime episode. I personally found it enjoyable to finish a game session in the end of a chapter, and then resume playing in the start of the next one.  [b] Nekopara Vol.1 [/b] has a free demo that includes all of chapter 1, so you should at least give it a try!

comentarios: Yeah, i bought it haha.  I've always heard about these games, and seen little snippets on the web so I had to try it.  Turns out it's really just a short visual novel (and I say novel in the lightest since possible) with no really game to be had in it.  There are no wrong or right choices.  You just keep clicking the next button until it's over.  Then you just forget you ever played it, and when your friends see your game list they say "Dude you actually played this.", and you say "Played what?  Oh, yeah...meh."

comentarios: I expected this to be a mindless, plotless bit of cute fluff and lewdness that I could tab over to during downtime in other games.  Instead, I plumbed the depths of human depravity in an unintentional horror story about an eerie world in which people are chattel, either abandoned to die hopeless and alone or treated as a mix of animal and idiot child unless their owners feel like fucking them. The developers of Nekopara needed to tackle the question of how their faceless, voiceless player self-insert vehicle would come to live in a cramped apartment with a bevy of amorous catgirls.   They had many options. They chose, apparently totally blind to the implications, the option in which humanity uplifts another terrestrial species to human levels of intelligence, but then elects to keep them as pets/slaves/sex toys, maintaining a system of psychological degradation and police-enforced dependence in order to keep them docile and reliant on their masters.  And nobody comments on this intensely unethical behavior--in fact, it is so normal that people publically praise individuals who chose to maintain sexual relations with sophonts who are a) their property, b) in an extremely submissive relationship (in terms of power dynamics), c) viewed as nonhuman animals or children by most of the population.  That's purely the worldbuilding. I could comment on the fetishization of mating seasons or the usual pseudo-incestuous relationships, but frankly none of that could top the entirely unintentional creepiness of the worldbuilding which makes the plot possible.  Of course this probably came about because they used 90% of the budget animating sex scenes and boob jiggle, leaving their writers to subsist on the packaging from the instant noodles the rest of the team ate. Long-term dehydration and malnourishment probably doesn't help the creative process.  "9/10, needs more mosaic censoring." -IGN

comentarios: A VN that is pleasant enough and funny at certain points but very abruptly changes tones much quicker than expected. This is short so there isn't much time to provide depth to the characters and the story could've used some work for it to make more sense and have a better payoff.  For instance, there's a point where the MC is essentially on death's door and passed out in bed. The two catgirls run out for help and then get into a bit of trouble. Minutes later, MC has hopped out of bed, is perfectly fine to head outside, somehow goes to the exact spot the girls are at and ends up saving them. You can't tell me a character is at death's door and then, with absolutely nothing changing, suddenly have that character up and running around. It makes no sense.  Anyway, pleasant enough but needed fleshed out more.

comentarios: If you own any of the Nekopara games on Steam then odds are someone bought it for you as a joke. If you DO decide to play them, be aware of two things, the first being that it's as standard of a visual novel as you'll ever get. It looks standard, feels standard, the story is standard, everything is standard. Second, there is no H stuff unless you specifically purchase the additional patches. And even then the H stuff is standard too. Feel free to ask me how I know, but it's not worth the time.     That said, I recommend it solely on the basis that people who enjoy visual novels won't have a bad time with this. But if you don't, don't waste your (or your friend's) money.   As for me though, I thought it was a decent romp. The mood is cheery and if nothing else, the game will make you laugh. You can probably guess the plot just by looking at it and you'll have a hearty guffaw when you realize you were correct.    All in all, it's an erotic VN / 10. You know what to expect.

comentarios: The cat girls were cute, but the developers overdid the "childlike innocence" and instead it came across as the cat girls literally having the mind of an 8 year old. Unless you are a pedophile, that's most likely not a turn on. I personally wasn't particularly interested in the sex parts and thought it would be cool to play it for the story as the cat girls were adorable and the art style is very beautiful. Sadly, the story sucks and is bland, there is nothing really going on.  Spoilers: You are a guy opening up a cafe, your sister's 2 cat girls mailed themselves to your cafe, you end up setting them up with their own room. You go shopping together and do mundane boring things as well as eat takoyaki while the cat girls act like children. It is really very boring and given that this eventually wanted to lead to sexual stuff, I think they made it very unappealing. Even as a porno this fails because you would have to scroll through huge walls of text to get to any sex parts.  If you like boring visual novels with girlchildren "love interests" and no plot, sure, you'll love it. If you were expecting some kind of story? Nah.  Not worth the money.

comentarios: By definition this isn't a game. It's more like an animated comic strip. I feel that this product being listed under games is misleading and should be sold as a simple animated manga. Also the rating is unfair. Nothing about anything I've seen would be considered 'Hentai'. While some of the conversation does discuss having sex the manga shows nothing inappropriate and aside from a few incestual comments from one or two characters the conversations are obscure enough to not be out of place. I don't think this is an animated manga appropriate for children, but I don't think it's engaging enough for adults. In all fairness I regret purchasing this.

comentarios: A well crafted story driven video game, very emotional and very well developed. Its completly original and there are no cliches or just used them to make the story better, iwas amazed by this feature. The gameplay is completly revolutionary. I spend a whole saturday just to master and try to comprehend such a complex way to play a game, all of the other most difficult gameplay experiences you've ever had will be completly blown away by how HARD this game was for me. Finally trhe character development is so deep and complex I was amazed. It ponders deep questions about the human nature between fighting for their own nature and insticts against some of the socially accepted constructs. If I were a teacher i'd use this videogame as an electronic learning tool for students to depate about the concepts of ethics, moral and philosophy.  My mom saw me playing it and she said nothing, also she believed the voices were from my 10 year old cousins, so that's a plus. Finally  I'll keep playing this game for at least 100 hours before uninstalling, it's completly not boring at all.  Edit: After some 50 hours i just realized there is an automatic option to not leave the game, when you hit close it automatically points to NO. So i'm never leaving this precious game.,

comentarios: I watched the anime Nekopara and its OVA this year and liked them both.  I never really considered buying the VNs on steam but after seeing the Summer Sale prices, I changed my mind. I am really glad that I made this decision.  Nekopara happens to be the second Visual Novel that I have played (The first VN I played was DDLC) and I have had a really decent experience.  The OVA is based on the Vol.1 however since it's only 55 minutes long, it doesn't cover up everything like this VN did.  The characters are all really amazing in such a way that they would keep you engaged with the VN.  The music is fun to listen to and the art style is soothing as well.  I never thought that I would ever give Visual Novels a go but after playing this, I have realised how amazing they are and I am definitely looking forward to play more.  I completed the first Volume and now I'll get started with the next one.  If you are a fan of Visual Novels, then I'd definitely recommend you this.

comentarios: After a year and a half and at least four readings, I think it's finally time I reviewed NEKOPARA. While the thousands of meme reviews are indeed quite funny, I figured it would be best for me to put in some serious effort. So then, let me share with you why this series, particularly this first volume, resonates so well with me.  Where do I start? Well, if you've taken a peek at some screenshots, you'll likely come to some easy conclusions. You may think the CGs are plentiful and varied, the backgrounds are high quality, and the sprites are incredibly detailed. Indeed, you'd be right, except for the last bit. You see, NEKOPARA isn't content with mere sprites that you'd see with most other visual novels. Instead, you'll notice that characters are in fact rendered in 3D, but still look very anime-esque. At least, that's the best way for me to describe them. Characters are in constant animation, often moving around in the screen space, with fluid facial expressions provided by the "e-mote" system. If you believe that VNs are too formulaic-looking, NEKOPARA will be a pleasant surprise.  In addition to glorious visual prowess, NEKOPARA also features complimentary sounds. There's a healthy amount of music, and each track does a good job of setting the tone of each moment. The opening theme never fails to get me dancing! Sound effects are numerous as well, and coupled with the visual movements, I find that they do a good job of eliminating the need of many awkward and drawn out descriptions that other VNs might require (though some of them are...well, you'll know when you hear them). As for the voice acting, I don't have any complaints really. I love how even though it's all in Japanese, you'll often hear English words and phrases thrown in nonchalantly. It's charming, really. Everything works together to be a joy for the senses.  As for the story, I'm not exactly sure what I expected. You've likely seen the memes already, and they're undoubtedly part of the drive behind the series' success. That said, NEKOPARA offers more than one might expect at first. At its core, the story is a slice of life with catgirls, which leads to some interesting moments, to say the least. It's about Kashou Minaduki, an aspiring baker who leaves his home and family business to open his own store. He's accompanied by two of his family's (more specifically, his sister Shigure's) catgirls, the carefree and oblivious Chocola, and the cheeky and intelligent Vanilla. These three learn to become an eccentric family-like unit together, all while learning to manage the new store. Overall, there are plenty of humorous and lighthearted moments. Even after several readings, they still manage to get some hefty laughs out of me. Chocola and Vanilla each have their quirks as catgirls, and I think the best moments are when they interact as a duo and show them off. Kashou himself his a bit dense, but I do like him in general. Occasionally though, things can get serious, and a couple times I managed to let a few tears loose. It's silly to think that such a story could pull that off, but maybe it's that very surprise that got to me the most. I won't spoil the ending chapter, but man, that did a number on me! Overall, I found the writing to be very solid, and no doubt much of this is thanks to a great localization. I won't try and proclaim that this volume is literary high art, but it understands exactly what it wants to do and does it very effectively.  Alright, I've managed to avoid it thus far, but it's about time we talk about the naughty bits. Yeah, the very basis of most of the memes. My first reading without the lewd patch was about five hours long. Later on when I finally did install it, I think it was roughly one hour of additional content. There's three scenes in all, and wow do they get intense. This is when the animations go into overdrive, and you may find out that your PC isn't quite up to snuff for them. In fact, if you notice the opening cinematic getting out of sync with the theme, I would recommend turning off those animations. Also, my goodness, those sounds effects are strange. As to the question of if you need the patch, well, it's your call. If you really don't want to participate in that stuff, don't feel pressured to, because it's not necessary to enjoy everything else. But if you're a connoisseur of such content, expect quality. There's a reason everyone talks about it...  I've praised this volume quite a bit already, but I guess I should address some nitpicks. Even though she has some good moments, I don't care much for Shigure. She's just crazy at times. Also, the scene in which all six Minaduki catgirls are present feels a bit crowded, and you don't get to much of a sense of the others until later on. Finally, while I was alright with it, I can imagine some readers may be put off by the intense voice acting, so I could understand if you feel the need to hush or completely mute it. Ultimately though, these are minor complaints, and this is all I could really think of to mention.  Now that I've said all I need to, I can fully recommend NEKOPARA vol. 1 to anyone who might be interested. If you're a veteran of visual novels, it's practically required reading. This was actually one of my first VN experiences, and it absolutely got me interested in the genre as a whole. Fair warning though, it may not be fair to expect other VNs to measure up to this series, because it's just that unique and great. While many of the reviews are humorous and not particularly informative, the overwhelmingly positive status they give does not lie. Unless you're highly averse to these offerings for whatever reason, I can't recommend NEKOPARA enough!

comentarios: I saw Dodger play the demo and thought it would be funny to do a let's play of the full game.  Even got my best friend to agree to what I -thought- would be a short, cutesy co-cast.  What we got was countless hours of recording an emotional rollercoaster: uncomfortable bonding, coping with alcoholism, developing the back story and lore of an Italian cashew masquerading as a French baker in Staten Island, Japan, battling to keep the game as Wholesome, Family-Fun™ for as long as possible, and trying to salvage a finale we accidentally skipped through twice.  Nekopara destroyed my channel and I still haven't shaken off all the subs asking for more catgirl/animu/VN videos.  100/10 actually the most enjoyable ball of fluff I've ever played.

comentarios: Nekopara is a Kinetic Visual Novel (Meaning you're reading a story with no decision making from you, the player.) The story centers around a man named Kashou Minaduki, who moved away from his family, without notice, to start a new life and open up the bakery he's always wanted. However, he is followed by two catgirls named Chocola, and Vanilla; two of the six catgirls that are within the Minaduki family. The two girls want to stay and live with Kashou because they love him, and that he's their "master". This is set in a world where catgirls are domesticated much like cats, so there's an owner and pet vibe going on, but they're obviously more intelligent than cats, and can do more. The rest of the story basically settles around Kashou coping with Chocola and Vanilla while trying to maintain the business and order of the bakery, and how the catgirls are going to affect his life and relationship with them.  This is a rather lighthearted story with lots of cute, funny moments coming from the two girls. A positive is that this story is fully voice acted (In Japanese), has animation thanks to a program called "E-Mote" where facial and body animations are possible, and a wonderful, casual soundtrack that's very memorable, and calming to listen to. There's also a decent amount of CG art that's made for specific scenes, with a little more detail.  Obviously, this story isn't for everyone. Like I said, it's a lighthearted story with funny moments and admittedly heartwarming chapters. You can really get attatched and connected to the characters if you're up for a tale such as this one. The story has lots of moments such as Chocola and Vanilla acting all cutesy and purring, meowing, stuff like that. People would be split on this depending on what you like, but I personally find that super adorable and makes the characters much more likeable.  It's not just that though, there is character development, and the story does actually go somewhere. It's not so much slice-of-life if you were thinking that. It mainly revolves around Kashou's relationship with Chocola and Vanilla, the bakery's business, and the girls earning their "bells" (Which you'll learn as you read along.) There is quite a few things going on, and the story never feels like it's halthing in one spot for too long.  If you like this kinda story, love catgirls, or are a fan of anime, then this is for you, it's vey polished and well done for what it is, and I was honestly surprised and what i got myself into. The story will take about 5-7 hours to read completely.  9/10

comentarios: What in the Oblivion Steam? When I heard this game has sex cut from it I expected something like Playstation 2 port of Fate Stay Night (excellent VN, play it), where they removed sex completely, and replaced sex scenes with apropriate scenes (storywise), and here we get: "Oh they do have sex, no you're not getting to watch it, you could get traumatized." treatment... OK, I understand that it's actually loli, so I guess there are some issues with showing them, but at the same time it's clearly shown they do get in action, so it's kinda useless censoring it (playing kinetic novel centered on relationship progress with sex clearly happening, but not shown, is like watching soccer game with every goal not being shown). Especially taking into account how Nekopara was created (I mean Vanilla and Chocola as characters).  Which takes me to other point. Why is it not OK to show sex on steam, but it's OK to show dismemberment, gore, mutilation, etc... A year ago friends kid, who for some reason likes to latch onto me asked me to download game for him called Sniper Elite, and out of curiosity, I decided to watch some videos from this series. In one lets play video PC shot a guy from sniper and suddenly game cut to a cutscene where bullet in slowmotion exited gun, hit victims head, and then we got to see how his skull got crushed, brain splattered, and bulet exited on the other side. comentarios: All the perverted jokes and silly reviews aside, Nekopara Vol. 1 is actually a very cute/funny read. If you're not super uptight and don't have some vendetta against cliches, it's worth the few hours you'll spend read-watching it, even if you go with steam's prudish version (BOOBS BAD GORE GOOD, right Steam?). I certainly laughed far more than I was expecting to.  Cons: Short-lived story VN, (non-skipping readers will get a good handful of hours out of it atleast), not enough entries in the series. Hopefully it becomes a long running VN series.  Pros: Very soothing soundtrack, with built in music player extras for your listening pleasure. Goofy cliches everywhere, pretty much guaranteed laughs for all but the most uptight/boring/sheltered of minds.  All in all, anyone who likes romance and CATGIRLS!!! . . . ahem, anyone who likes romance, catgirls, goofy cliches, 3rd-person speaking, and general sillyness, will definitely enjoy this.  Now excuse me while I go try and find the...Ahem, 'removed' content. F-For review purposes, I swear!

comentarios: [b]Vanilla[/b] is a clever and quiet catgirl who loves Chocola. She is Chocola’s twin sister and the youngest among the Minaduki catgirls. [b]Vanilla[/b] is prone to be misunderstood because she rarely expresses her emotions. In fact, she is quite smart and often makes some remarkable insights. Her sharp wit and I’ll-do-things-my-way attitude make her Chocola’s complete opposite. However, she remains both kind-hearted and, well, catlike.  In contrast to her twin Chocola, [b]Vanilla[/b]'s ears, tail and hair are primarily white with a subtle pink undertone. She has blue eyes which are often slightly squinted, and her hair is tied up and styled as twin tails supported by a blue ribbon strand.  Her usual attire consists of a light blue and navy blue lolita-style dress with white shin-length socks with garter trims and blue Mary Jane shoes. She wears two large blue ribbons; one on the top of her head and one on her collar. Her left hand is lightly wrapped around with a blue string and she wears a small garter near the tip of her tail.  [b]Vanilla[/b] is quiet, calm and very stoic. She rarely expresses her emotions, making her a somewhat of a kūdere character, as opposed to her sister's energetic, playful personality. She loves her twin sister Chocola and will accompany her always due to her sis-con-like relationship towards her.  [b]Race:[/b] Catgirl [b]Breed:[/b] Mixed Breed [b]Gender:[/b] Female [b]Age:[/b] 9 months old [i](11 years old in human age)[/i]

comentarios: Let me spin you a tale of my life. Back when I was a lad somewhere in my first or second year of highschool a friend said, "hey, do you want Nekopara?" and I, being the innocent pure lad I was, said "sure" because I thought, "man this'll be funny to have." So I had it, and I sat on it, then sometime later I say "haha you know what would be really funny? If I got all the achievements" so I booted up Nekopara and spammed my way through the game, ultimately taking up three hours of my life. All achievements unlocked and three hours on my account. It was at that point that I realized something. How can people tell I was joking? I tell friends this story but part of me worries "what if they don't believe me? what if people start thinking that I actually wanted a visual novel about catgirls? What do I do now?" To tell you the truth I still have no answer to that question, but, it was free, and it led to a friend gifting me "Slender: Hentai Edition" several years later. So, in the end I may forever be tainted in the eyes of others, but I got free stuff, and for me, the greedy rat bastard I am, that's a good deal. But to be completely honest, do I recommend this? Eh, it's not really my thing, but if you're reading reviews with the hope of finding out if it's actually good or not I just gotta say: come on man. You know what you're getting, descend into degeneracy or rise above us plebians who forever have our libraries stained by the Japanese catgirls.

comentarios: [h1] [[Note: This review is written from using the uncensored version of the game.]] [/h1]  This review is for the visual novel of Nekopara Vol. 1.  This isnt really a game, but an experience better then most books can offer. Without spoiling any plot, I suggest anyone picking up this story gets the uncensored orginal patch to play the game.  I feel with the story's tone and mood playing the censored verison of the game is a great dishonner to the artists and story writer. If you like japan, if you like cat girls, then just get this one.  Trust me, this is a high quality visual novel thats worthy of anyone's time. It has good humor, art, music, and a decent storyline. It also tries to explain how cat like people live, react, and the laws that effetc them.  Just get the game, and use the uncensored patch to add back in the orginal content.   You wont regret it.

comentarios: Cat Paradise, 'nuff said  ....Honestly, as I see many VN, this game is an okay for me. It may has some flaw but it's not too bad. Pros + Very good art : What did you expected from Sayori? It's beautifully drawn image of cause!! + Feel lively : E-mote help this so much + Relaxing story : Has little serious moment, for those who want to refresh from stress + Something that bounce : Well, I'm not into this thing much but I think it's a nice touch Cons - Too short : It ends quicker than I thought, or my VN standard is around longer game, idk. - Something is off : I feel like there's detail that left untold, but maybe it's just me - Take your risk : Seriously, You'll look like an Otaku just for having this game even if you're not.  Still recommended if you want some relaxing VN with good art, maybe buy when it's cheap. (I did just that)  If you pick this game a try, well.... Good luck with your Catpanions

comentarios: A short kenetic visual novel. Overall it is not a bad game.  Why not recommended then? Simply because there is really only one single reason to play this game. That being to look at very nicely drawn pictures of catgirls. Apart from that there is really nothing here. So if that is something you would enjoy, by all means go ahead and play. If you are wanting something a little more substantial in terms of content though, there is really nothing here.  The story plays out sort of like a 4-koma. In that there are chapters, but these are further divided into several short vignettes. It is basically a slice-of-life story about a man opening a bakery and training two catgirl staff. In a relationship that later becomes sexual in nature. And yes even this Steam version makes certain you know you are missing sex scenes, they just show the before and after.  I think if this game were a comedy, it would have turned out really great. The style would have fit a comedy really well. But this is unfortunately not a comedy. For such a rediculous background story and world, the game is remarkably terse and serious in tone. There is some situational stuff and jokes, but nothing consistant enough to make the reader have fun. In that sense taking this solely as a story, it is fairly generic and boring. It is just cute girls doing cute things, that personally isn't really enough to carry it.  The main saving grace is that it is short. If it were longer than the 2-4 hours it is, it would have outstayed its welcome being as simple as it is. That said the value for money at $10 seems a little lacking because of that. Vol. 2 really will have to do something to change up the situation a little. Unfortunately I expect it will be more of the same, just more catgirls in the shop.

comentarios: When I was a little boy, I visited my father in the hospital. He was in and out of conciousness, but while he was relatively lucid he told me that I had to grow up quickly and teach myself how to be a man. He told me that, although it was going to be difficult, I would have to become the kind of person that he always knew I could be and make both him and my mother proud. He said that I needed to learn how to value my life and use my time to discover for myself what was, and was not, important to me. Two days later, he passed away... Now, ten years later, I'm sitting at my computer spending hours reading a VN about a guy who wants to f@ck genetically engineered catgirls while operating a bakery... I guess what I'm trying to say is: I DID IT PAPA! YOUR BABY BOY DUN DIDDIT! Even though he's no longer with me, I like to think he's looking down at me, alone, sitting at my computer and resting easy in the knowledge that I took his advice to heart. 13/10 would make tastless and long-winded joke about my dead father again.

comentarios: I am a 45 yo father, probably one of the oldest people playing this game. I am a single father to my Son, who is 14 now. My son got this game for Christmas in 2022 from his uncle, so we installed it on his computer and he started playing. By the end of the week he had 24 hours on this game. This was horrible for me, as it was already hard for me to find ways to spend time with my son, as he is always out with his friends or just watching YouTube. So i decided to make a Steam account and get this game to see if I could maybe play alongside him. I loaded into the game, picked my character and world and started playing but I was stuck on what you where supposed to do. I asked my Son for help and he hosted a game for me to join. I loved it as it was the best time I had spent with my Son since my wife had died. This game has ever since brought me and my son closer again and now we actually spend time together outside the house together as well. This game reminded me that there's fun to be had in everything, and it has brought both me and my Son many happy memories.

comentarios: Yes, there is an R-18 patch. No, you're not really missing out on too much if you don't patch your game. It's pretty obvious what's going on and, if you *really* want to see, that's what Tumblr is for. The only reason I didn't patch is because, frankly, I'm lazy.  Story wise, it's very cute and does a good job of establishing characters and scenes before diving into sexy tropes. The art is simply beautiful to look at and all the animations are very smooth. Music and voice acting are also lovely to listen to. Even though their cat girls, they're never THOSE kind of cat girls, if you know what I mean.   Characters are very cute and there is some solid humor in the game too. The only downside is that the story does leave some strange implications that make you want to take a long shower to scrub away the shame though.   While I do wish that Steam had left the R-18 version intact (especially when you have to be over 18 to view the store page), it's really not needed for this title. It's just as enjoyable and explicit without it.

comentarios: Note: I played the non-patched adult version, meaning no sexual content was shown or told, but time lapsed over.  I had to read these in short bursts, like a chapter each.  People kept implying it was a porn-game with the screenshots I kept seeing so wasn't interested in getting it. A friend gifted me this and Vol 0. I read vol 0 first and wrote a review for that then started reading this. (Vol 0 review here: http://steamcommunity.com/id/BluePaw/recommended/385800 )  There's a lot of tear jerking moments that at times seems overwhelming or ubundent, or just drones on as filler that it gets annoying and want to move on. The characters you meet are unique in their own way. The animation for a VN seemed good. Voices... I guess were okay? Usually prefer english dub in Anime so... what do I know?  How the story ended left a sour taste in my mouth... felt it should've ended a few chapters sooner.  However... despite all that, I loved it. I was slowly warming up & understanding the characters and the world they lived in. My only constant irk was catgirls always refering to their owners as "master"... I understand it's part of that world but just felt awkward, always, when they tell that to the guy you're viewing from that it feels like they're saying that to the reader directly.  There was suggestive themes that I didn't mind since it didn't get carried away or annoying, as they were either comical or romantic... however some parts were overly romantic that I wanted to throw up! (I'm not a romance person, obviously.)  This is a good read though. The story is actually interesting overall and the characters have their purpose in the story, regardless of how they were designed. This isn't a porn game, this is a story with minor adult themes but not focused on such things.  I have no interest in getting the 18+ or patch as I prefered, in this VN, to time lapse them and let me speculate what could happened on the after-math scene. Wouldn't feel comfortable to see such a thing with these characters.  -----  Check out more games I see that deserve more attention from my curator group: [url=http://steamcommunity.com/groups/BPUGL]BluePaw's Underrated Games List[/url] Join and/or follow if you wish.

comentarios: Here is my review of Nekopara Vol. 1  I really liked the game. The game tells the beginning of the story. From little nekos to big nekos. The music is also top again. 😄  A long story with lots of text and lots of animations. You can set the jiggle physics again. For the anime tiddies. 😅 You can unlock several achievements. 😉  Well, the humor speaks for itself and the atmosphere is nice too. I'm happy with the game. 😁  Feeling and Characters:  Protagonists: Kashou Minaduki, Chocola, Vanilla, Maple, Shigure Minaduki, Azuki, Maple, Cinnamon and Coconuts. Antagonist: None Surroundings/ Feeling: Maid Café, City, Neko Paradise. 🐱   Here is my final/ end video:  https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Wa1dFefaDyc  Thanks to Steam, NEKO WORKs and Sekai Project. 👍

comentarios: So kawaii ,,,^-^,,, Neko <3  Chest bounciness slider added into the options menu? Yeah... this game gets a 10/10 right there. xD  In all honesty though, one of the best animated VNs of all time. The amount of work they put into this is just amazing. Character details and animations are brilliantly done for a VN. They even incorporated the game window into the game, moving the game in windowed mode moves the characters in the game.  Slightly a short VN in comparison to others, story is well done but not the best, personally I believe the story could of been better. There is only one path in the game, but it doesn't effect the game's entertainment at all. When Vol 2 is made and released, I'm sure they'll incorporate more paths and possibly and even larger story.  I will give this VN a 10/10 though, even though the story was slightly lacking, the VN's entertainment was top notch, and the animation is out of the world. Not to mention, it starts the story of a series and opens up for Vol 2.

comentarios: The  motion  in  this  game  is  fantastic  same  with  the  artwork.  As  a  anime/manga  lover  and  a  person  who  reads  a  lot  of  anime  visual  novels  i  just  cant  get  into  this game. The  plot  itself  is  just terrible  and  the  explaination  for  cat  girls  doesnt  make  sense  either. To  me  its  just fan  service, i  dont  mind  fan  service  but  with  an  unexcusible  plot  with  it  just  unsatisfies  me. Its  very  cute and  moe  but  i  cannot  explain  why  it  bugs  me  after  reading  it.  It  has  a  wonderful  system  i do  admit  but  i  hope  in  the  future  people   will  not make  visual  novels  with  motion  in  it,  that  to  me  will  just  ruin  visual  novels  itself  for  me.  One  of  the  settings  for  it,  is  Chest Bounciness, which  i  find  absurd  and  amusing,  i  can  see  why  people  would  buy  it  because  its very  cute  and  moe.  I  did  get  the  demo  for  this  game  and  was  thrilled  but  when  it  was released  everything  was  off  for  me. There  is  barely  any  character  development,  but  so  far  this  is  just  an opinion. Though  the  characters  personality  is  good  and  i  like  it,  but  the characters  postures  and  tone  of  voice  sounds  weird  to  me,  its  not  flown  well  with  eachother.    I  want  to  spread  anime  love but  not  like this, i  feel  like  the  anime  community  is  just  silly  and is  known  well  for  its  perverted  fan  service,  fan  service  isnt  bad  but  too much  gets  in  the  way  of  the  plot   thus  making  it  look  bad. This  game  offers  tight  clothing  and  a  lot  of  panty shots,  I  feel  like its a starting  point  for  motion  visual  novels.  I  believe  that  motion  visual  novels  wont  be  as  good  as  non  mottion  ones.  Ive  been  watching  and  reading  romance  genre  animes  for  almost  12  years.  I  felt  like  the  romance  in  this  novel  went by  too  fast  that its  unatural  and  has  no  reason  why  they  would  fall  in  love.  I  dont  know  how  the  main character  can  handle  2 l ove  intrests  either  nor  both  Vanilla  and  Chocola  can  deal  with  it.  My final  result  for  this  game  is 4.5/10  but  this  is  an  opinion  by  me  so  dont  let  this  encourage you  not  buying  the  game  i  say  try  out  the  demo and see if  you  like  it  or  not. (hey at least i didnt say it was crap, i didnt even compare to school days now that anime was an embarassment to all animes hehehe :p) I  know  most  of  you  will  not  like  this  review  but  stare  at  the cute  cat  maids. Feel  free to leave  your  opinion  down in  the chat  bar  thingy. ;)

comentarios: Cute, simple and well polished Visual Novel. Great artwork from Sayori, awesome voice acting and cool animations. The downside is that it's really short and the character development goes way too fast. The story feels kinda rushed. That been said, yes, if you like catgirls or Sayori's previous works you are gonna totally enjoy this.  For the love of god, patch in the R+18 after you buy it. comentarios: This game fire 10/10. Anyways here is a recipe on a lemon poppyseed cheesecake  1-1/2 cups graham cracker crumbs 3 tablespoons butter, melted 4 packages (8 ounces each) cream cheese, softened 1 cup sugar 2 tablespoons all-purpose flour 2-1/2 teaspoons vanilla extract 5 large eggs, room temperature, lightly beaten 1/2 cup heavy whipping cream 1/4 cup lemon juice 1 tablespoon grated lemon zest 1/3 cup poppy seeds  Preheat oven to 350°. In a small bowl, combine graham cracker crumbs and butter. Press onto the bottom and 1 in. up the sides of a greased 9-in. springform pan. Set aside. In a large bowl, beat cream cheese, sugar, flour and vanilla until smooth. Add eggs, cream, lemon juice, zest and poppy seeds. Beat on low speed just until combined. Pour into prepared crust. Place pan on a baking sheet. Bake until center is almost set, 55-60 minutes. Cool on a wire rack for 10 minutes. Carefully run a knife around edge of pan to loosen; cool 1 hour longer. Refrigerate overnight. Remove sides of pan. Refrigerate leftovers.

comentarios: It's a story about a little sister that loves you romantically, but since you're unwilling to engage in a relationship that taboo, she sends two of her catgirls to be your girlfriends instead (which is apparently just the right level of taboo for your character). It's super weird, but if you don't take it too seriously it's actually a fun little visual novel.   Pros: -Great Art -Adorable characters. Yes, I have a weakness for anime catgirls.   -It sticks to the genre without being overly long. This technically isn't a game, but it's also not trying to be. It's a short visual novel without any extra expectations or baggage.  -Pretty much anime crack (or catnip, if you prefer)  Cons: -The story is nonsense. As mentioned above, it's anime crack. If you're looking for something deeper, this ain't it. At least the game knows what it is though. I hate visual novels and anime that act like they're so deep and meaningful but are just bloated, edgy teen fodder *coughattackontitancoughcodegeasscough*.  -Music is just OK, and gets repetitive fast.   Neutral: -There is 18+ DLC for anyone into that. Whether that's a pro or con is up to you.

comentarios: Lovely illustrations as expected, fully voiced and the animations really help to bring the cat girls to life!  A surprising amount of options for a VN, it might only be native 720p but it still looks and runs great and has many options for different scaling and cropping to full screen for any unexpected screen sizes.  I really like that it's possible to change languages on the fly and also to have multiple languages visible at once if you choose. It really shows the amount of effort that went into this release. It also has controller support which is handy for playing with Steam home streaming on TV.  It's a shame that the AO version isn't on Steam, but that's Valve's fault for believing that it's necessary to push American values on the rest of the world. You can buy the best version on DLsite and paste it over the top of the Steam version's folder for the best of both worlds.  Hopefully we get trading cards and cute backgrounds soon, that's the only thing I can think of that's missing.  Sayori is my hero!

comentarios: Some negative experiences, you just have a speech lined up for. Because something wonderful or at least interesting was on the line, and you want to vent the loss of the baby with the bathwater.  But for Nekopara? This kinetic visual novel that has just taken Steam by storm?  It has been a while since I have met something that somehow manages to be so underwhelming and uninteresting and yet quite so disgusting. Such so, that I don't even feel much need to copy-paste most of the copious notes I've taken as to why this is one of the most noxious, revolting, dislikable pieces of trash I've ever entertained on my hard drive.  But let me share a few.  There are major incestuous themes or at least implications that go unpunished, even presented as wholesome or pleasant; the "catgirls" are *nothing* like cats - the things in this VN are way too friendly, loyal, and affectionate to have *anything whatsoever* to do with felines - and there is generally an atmosphere and worldbuilding core of abuse in glittery paint. Aside from the incest, or at least incest-coded interactions, these human girls with cat features are "owned", living as slaves, as living playthings, and it's played up as this wholesome thing. And the writers have the gall to try to push some BS that they're actually more cat than human, "because ears and tail." It's like an excuse for a right-wing political policy; so stupid and insufficient to allay the elephant in the room it's supposed to explain away, delivered so confidently and unapologetically it either forces you to go along with it or sickens you to your gut. Or both.  __  But okay, let's say you're kind of feeling in the mood for an "Arabamu" lewd setup and you think the Emancipation Proclamation was a mistake. Well, what's wrong with Nekopara then?  Plenty, frankly. The story is underwhelming and uninteresting, just a day-by-day with no evident stakes and it basically being anime people doing anime things until you get to lewd scenes. I'd be up for a slice-of-life, if it's interesting, but Nekopara isn't.  The characters themselves, which are supposed to be the meat of the experience, apparently, get redundant and annoying, really fast; their interactions and dialogue might be bearable, even sparsely likable, in a different sort of VN, but for a game wie're here for the lewds for and we know it? And one *THIS LONG*? They're just obnoxious and don't add anything interesting to the plot or social atmosphere.  Speaking of lewd? Perhaps the biggest outrage of all is that it's not even in here, by default. You have to pay the whole price of the VN again, just to see what is probably only two or three scenes that I bet I could easily look up on a seedy website if I wanted to. It's insulting. Yes, I dislike that the dialogue seems to be incest-coded, but if you're going to put that in a game you are expressly selling for its lewd content, at least have the stones to double down and put your lewd content in as part of the main, whole purchase, lock, stock, and barrel.  Oh, did I say game? Excuse me. This isn't even a game. It's a "kinetic visual novel". There's no option to interact with the story or characters in any way. This just plays in one direction, with the same outcome, each time. This is basically a porn video if you ever thought "gee, I sure wish these porn videos had *more* talking heads, had most of their action in subtitles, and that I had to regularly click to make it play instead of clicking the once and just watching" - oh, and where you have to buy the video, then buy it *again* to see the actual *porn* in it.  And for gosh sakes, even the worldbuilding isn't worth a dime. The aforementioned genetic excuse they pull out of their ass for the girls' being cats is just the tip of the iceberg. There are stupid rules about the arrest of these "cat" girls, a "family" of eight somehow surviving on a singular traditional candy shop...  For hell's sake, even though this takes place in a bakery, and the Kashou guy presents himself as being all qualified and set up as a proper baker, through and through, I am convinced he's a fraud. He calls a Sponge Cake batter a "dough".an eyebrow-raiser but forgivable.  But wrapping it up and saving it for later!? WRAPPING! UP! *SPONGE CAKE*! BATTER! and SAVING IT FOR LATER!? I am in an Advanced Baking course as I type this (just got back, a bit of a coincidence now that I think about it) and this is one thing we DO NOT DO WITH SPONGE CAKES!  ___  If this were some obscure niche VN tucked in Steam's dark corners, maybe I wouldn't feel this angry. But the fact this is so popular that Steam expressly merchandises animated avatar images and other things about it, and its pics are all over the place for anything to do with lewd games or sci-fi cartoon girls to date? That is insulting. There are a hundred games that deserve stardom more than this - NSFW and SFW alike.  If you really want to spend ten - or depending on how desperate you are, twenty- dollars on a frustrating ghost of an experience when you could buy much better ones for five dollars or see a much longer one for free, go for it. Just don't say I didn't warn you.

I've known about Nekopara for over a Decade it seems.  Before Steam was big, it was sold as a top tier game from Japan on J-list. Surely it didn't have the censorship this one has. comentarios: So my family still think I'm some lowlife living in their loft with my waifu pillows and I can't really hold that against them cause it's true.  I think however, them seeing me on this game has led them to the verge of getting me counseling again but as this is a review of the game I can say, it's fucking worth it.   I played the demo for this game and by God was I blown away. The visual experience is astounding. I've never seen a visual novel look so amazing. The lip syncing is really good, the character animation is spot on and the general art is just brilliant as well. Who doesn't want to be surrounded by kawaii neko girls? That's right. Republicans.  The story is pretty good. You play as some guy who's fucking off to make his own bakery and become fucking Buddy Valastro from Cake Boss. Basically these cat girls who he's been living with while with his family go all Metal Gear in cardboard boxes in a moving truck to tag along with him and the story pretty much starts there.  They also have this OP song and video thing. Fuck me, it's like I'm on an acid trip. That shits amazing, like honestly, fucking amazing. I feel like I've been shifted from a visual novel to an anime. It's pretty crazy. Not only that, they've got a wide range of characters to meet so your not stuck with a few girls.   Might I also add that this game, THIS GAME! Has in the options a 'Chest Bounciness' option. Now, I'm pretty damn sure I'm not the only one here thinking this but DAMN! You know you've found a fucking good game when they have CHEST BOUNCINESS in the options menu. Genius.   Also I'd like to add that the price is great. The game is enjoyable and takes quite some time so for £6.99 full price or however much that is for 'Murica or other nationalities I imagine not that much more.   All in all, 10/10 will get hentai version.

comentarios: Okay, I think it's time for some real talk: It was mentioned in the story that Chocola and Vanilla are only 9 months old, and they are about 12~ years old in human age. Knowing this, we can safely assume that a 1 year old catgirl is around the human age of 16, and you know what 16 year olds do? That's right! They get drafted into the army.  These catgirls' military value is astonishing. They turn from an infant into a well developed human being who is completely capable of speech in mere 12 months. Not only that, but judging from this quick growth I can guess that even their reproduction rate is similar to felines, so before getting sent to the frontlines they can even produce a couple of offsprings, who can get trained and sent out the following year aswell, only growing in numbers.  Besides that, even on the field they have their advantages, being more agile than normal humans, and the potential to exploit their looks, because no man in their right mind would ever shoot an adorable cat girl.  Wake up mankind, these creatures aren't our salvation, but supersoldiers, who bring our undoing, AND NO ONE REALISES TH- ...oh right ...the review  It's about cute cat girls saying "Nya~" and such, so go for it I guess, it's pretty wholesome.

comentarios: NEKOPARA is a VN based on Pantheon becoming what he wanted, except his personal space was invited by his family's Nekos*. Instead of filing a restraining order, he keeps them with him.  The VN novel itself is mediocre at best, with a few key elements. First, it's one of the few VN's to be animated, and not some pictures wired up (Though at parts, there are pictures, though this is obvious). Another key element is that the VNs are Voice-Acted (VA), thus bringing in MORE spirit.  One of the main attractions for me, however, was that the game contains hentai. To get the uncensored version you either: -A: Pay for the uncensored version online, and apply a patch to the Steam version -B: Pirate said patch -or C: Buy the uncensored version online, then set it to be a Steam game.  The main problem is that the game lures you with hentai, should you be a fan of hentai, and then makes you pay an extra 10 dollars, which just screams BS.  One of the problems I've had that's very common with the game is ''Invalid character AE''. If you don't want to deal with said problem, install the VN on C: instead of D:.  Verdict: A VN that is definitely worth checking, but pay online or pirate the patch for the hentai.  Final Verdict: 7/10 for the base VN, 8/10 for the hentai parts. The hentai parts did not feel empty, yay.

comentarios: My family struggled for food, we lived in Iraq at the time. I had no motivation, I was depressed, lonely, and barely managed to get out of bed each day. One day I finally brought myself to go on discord for the first time in a year and had a single dm from my only friend. All it said was "nekopara." I took a sip of my final glass of water (the water hole ran out) and downloaded it, it took 40 hours (best internet in the area). Immediately after mere seconds of opening it, I finally felt encouraged to do something. I applied for every job in my area and managed to secure 47 out of 10 of them, I worked all day long week after week, and finally managed to leave Iraq (without my family) and now I spend my days playing nekopara. I wish to do nothing else with my life. I am in love with Nekopara.

comentarios: When I played Vol. 0, I made the joke that I had many unanswered questions regarding the existence and status of catfolk in this world. I fully expected it to just be glossed over or handwaved, to be honest. Now I just feel like a fool.  Imagine my genuine surprise when the mental checklist of out-there, absurd worldbuilding requests I planned to joke about was slowly ticked off throughout the game. Things like the view of catfolk/human relationships, the rate of aging, catfolk's status in society, whether or not catfolk and people can reproduce, etc. Why would a cutesy eroge bother even mentioning any of this, I thought? Hence why my absurdist review would mark that as a faux complaint. But it's all there, and as subtly horrific as it should be. And I love that.  In all seriousness, it's very cute. The ero scenes are whatever, I'd honestly say not to bother spending the extra cash on em if you're on the fence about it. Ultimately, though, it's your call whether you want this as a hardcore eroge or a cutesy romance story. I can respect the fact that it caters to both crowds.

comentarios: [h3]TLDR at the bottom for those who respect their own time.[/h3]  I'm a huge sucker for all things cute and the art for the Nekopara games is adorable!  The plot however..? [i]Eh...[/i] The relationship between Kashou and his catpanions really could have used more development as there's hardly any chemistry between them (literally the only reason they end up in a relationship is because the catgirls go into heat, like that's pretty much it.) I feel as if the characters never got to grow, both as individuals and in their relationships with each other, it's a bit of a shame, really, but maybe that's not what NEKO WORKs was trying to accomplish, and that's okay. Still, i was hoping for that "Oh thank GODS they finally kissed!" moment, which i was left a bit disappointed, as i'm sure it would have very much enriched the overall plot and enhanced the [i]"plot"[/i] scenes.  Speaking of... the ""PLOT"" here is of fine quality; the art is stunning and erotic af, the music suits the mood, and the voice acting really sells it (No other comments, easy 8.5/10 macaroons.)  Also, can we talk about the music? Like yeah yeah it does it's job of setting the tone for the game rather well, but tracks like Cat Work and Nya Soliel are straight up bangers! Great for easy listening and perfect for vibing to while snacking on your favorite pastry. (also also, there's a titty elasticity meter, do with that as you will but it's not really my kind of thing lol.) Still was hoping for a more romantic edge, but I enjoyed Vol. 1 a bit more than I thought I would... at least enough for me to move on to Vol. 2!  Thanks for your time dear reader, and farewell!  [h2]TLDR:[/h2] The [b]plot[/b] is good, but the actual plot could be better. The music and art are lovely and cute, [strike]also I love Maple and Coconut very much![/strike] I enjoyed my time at the cat cafe, and i feel like if you're reading this, there's a chance you will too!

But aside from that I did find the interesting way that the characters were animated in scenes to be pretty cool. Just turn down the "boob jiggle" because it's really freaking annoying. Overall Nekopara 0-2 are "okay" at best. They are not something for me, but I decided to make the best of it and put a "recommend" because this game made me feel like a piece of shit for playing it and I don't want to feel like a piece of shit all alone.

comentarios: I'm usually a huge fan of these types of games, but this game had no real conflict. You do absolutely nothing but click through it. There are no decisions or options except to change the language. The graphics are really clear and the 3D idea is great, but the story is extremely boring, and I almost had to force myself to play this game. If none of this bothers you, go right ahead and get it. But if you want a game that's actually a GAME, rather than a book without a plot, then don't.

comentarios: I admit, I played it. All the way through. I got every acheivement because, really, it was just too easy... Physically. Mentally, i was not prepared for this kind of... Software. I never touched a visual novel in my life up until now. Needless to say, i'm very shaken, but i will not let this deter my critique for this game. Sure, i may not LIKE the concept, and i may not LIKE the content, but i can see why someone would very much like it. It just doesn't appeal to me. The game is well made, it works flawlessly, and for my computer, the frame rate is fantastic, and i'd say i have a low-end PC. I'm just shocked how well made it is for this kind of...Software. Simply put, if you like the genere, and you like the concept, you're going to love this game. If you're new to the genre and are looking forward into committing yourself into playing more games like this... Eh, try the free visual novel before buying this. I'd reccomend it if you're a fan of visual novels. Unfortunately, i'm not, but... Eh, this is for those of you who do, so, fuck it. I'm reccomending it.

comentarios: NEKOPARA Vol. 1 is a visual novel about uh....Nekos x). The story is about Kashou, who has always wanted to be a western ''pâtissier''. He decided to work his own way to manage his bakery named ''La soleil pâtisserie''. However, arriving at his bakery, he found 2 of his old cat friends - Chocola and Vanilla. At first He tried to make them leave, but soon after, he knew that he was actually forced to accept them to work together with him. You will see how they are going to co-operate and develop their relationships between them little by little, following the story.   This one is quite exclusive and different from the other VNs with its ''E-mote'' system, which adds movements and changes to their attitudes and gests during the dialogue, even without clicking it. Which is almost a perfect combination with those cute catgirls since it makes them even more attractive. [spoiler]Notice that there are quite some sexual themes in the original version of this VN, you can still enable it on steam by an add-on system; albeit I still recommend you to play this VN with a feeling of ''pure'' love, not that kind of ''feeling''.[/spoiler]  Positive remarks +E-mote which makes this game more lively +dynamic and romantic soundtracks  +very well-designed graphics +actually appropriate for all ages if you play the steam version +a different genre of characters- cats!^^  Negative remarks -the R18 version (or positive for ''some'' players) -a little too short

comentarios: My friend gifted me this. On my birthday. I'm not even joking.  I told him about this Japanese game called Nekopara which is the game that made hentai internationally famous on Steam, and as soon as I told him about the game, he gifted me this.   His letter said,  "Mr. Hentai, here is the cyber girlfriend that you always wanted"  Mr. Hentai-_-..................................  So anyway, I beat the game (More like I only kept pressing the space button since all I wanted to see was hentai), and well, the game is good.   Here are some of the things that make this game good:   1. Fluent hentai animation (Now, this can be seen only if you have the hentai version of the game). Now, what makes a good hentai game, a good hentai game? It is those good animations. There are many of them that only have just the pictures, but this one is the real deal. The animation is so natural, my Steam FPS counter says I am running it on 59~60 FPS on average.  2. Story. Well, uh, I don't know about the story because all I was interested in was hentai   I actually like how this game has 3 languages, Japanese, English and Chinese. Now you can tell hentai games are slowly taking over Steam.   I am expecting more from this maker.   Verdict: 69 out of Oppai   This game deserves those awards:   - OoTY (Oppai of the Year) - HoTY (Hentai of the Year) - PoTY (Pantsu of the Year) - WoTY (Waifu of the Year)   Cheers, my fellow hentai brothers.
