comentarios: I played this game during a bout of heavy insomnia, stress (moving houses/downsizing) and anxiety. at first i was intriuged at the thought of girls that were also cats (once a wholsome concept to me i assure you) but around the time of the "give us a bath"scene (if you've played it, you'll understand) i began to realize the true horror that was "NEKOPARA Vol. 1" after the aforementioned scene i clung to my chair as the lights in our neighbor's house flicked on and in my desk mirror, i watched my neighbor's eight year old son stare on in horror through  his livingroom window into our diningroom window (moving houses so no curtians) as the cat girls "chesticles" ungulated at high velocity. at this point i could do no more than turn off my monitor and then all the lights in the room untill his mother escorted him sternly (assuming) back to his bedroom. after that, i decided to tempt fate and return to the game (i have to finish what i start... i'm also sort of a self loathing masochist) i ended up completeing the game with all but two achivements (something that jiggles...) and by the time dawn rolled around my face was frozen in a perpetual scowl and my voice obliterated from screaming "NO!" as loudly as possible. overall, not a bad game for someone who's into this sort of thing, but for eight year old boys discovering voyurism for the first time, curiosity definately killed the catgirl.

comentarios: The year is 20XX. In what would later become known as the 2nd Great Thermonuclear War, Russia and the United States of America, the two great superpowers of the Earth, launched an all out nuclear offensive against each other. The sheer volume of warheards launched was so gigantic, that many of the missles collided over the North Pacific. This caused the atomic fallout to blow over to the neutral ground of Japan. The pollution reacted with the double X chromosomes in Japanese females, causing over 60% of the population to mutate into catlike hybrids.  In this fast paced first person shooter, you play as a special black ops soldier who is a member of the strike force known as NEKOPARA, callsign "Master". His mission: to eradicate the catgirl abominations with extreme prejudice.  The game incorporates a new morality system of choosing to spare or kill various catgirls you meet during the story. Spare earns their trust, but killing them seperates you furthur from your humanity, allowing you to take more damage in battle.  The choice is yours, decide the destiny.

comentarios: And then a friend got me a catgirl VN...    Nekopara is a Visual Novel where you get laid with catgirls!  That's what this game is!  You play this in order to overwhelm yourself with naughty feelings, and they will likely involve ladies with cat ears and tails!  Anyway, beat it in 4 hours using a keyboard and mouse.  The game has no difficulty; it's a VN.  Very adult.    - There are 8 chapters total, each running roughly 30 minutes of listening to voices in Japanese with accompanied text (in English, Japanese, or Chinese.)   - The game is just reading text.  There's nothing ground-breaking here like multiple choices or choosing what you say.  You're in this for the read.  - The menu has pictures, videos, and music from the game to access at any time after you beat the game.  - The base game is censored and lacks the kinkier scenes.  To get the 'full' game you have to pay extra for the +18 patch.  Even so, sex is still heavily implied and cannot be ignored.  Though why you'd get this without wanting the 18+ junk is beyond me.    - There is no TissueBox DLC.  You will have to acquire that on your own accord outside the main game.  - P.  PP.  PPPPPPPPPPPPPPPPPP.      In summary, Nekopara is one of THOSE games.  If you're into lewd PssPssPss, you will very much like this game.  If you're into catgirls or furries, well, read the last sentence.  If you're a parent getting this for your kid, wtf?  Why would you do that?  What's wrong with you?

comentarios: Characters: 6.5/10  The main character is relatable, and his role seems to be something of a bastion of reliability, and, well... normalcy. His sister, although quite quirky, is also well written. The two main catgirls, by contrast, often behave instinctually, and can be unpredictable. To be honest I found their characters a little exaggerated at times, and difficult to engage with.  Story: 6/10  The story is long, but slow. Character develop and plot development happen in relatively discrete steps, rather than a gradual progression, which for me made immersion difficult. The development of relationships between the characters similarly seemed a little difficult to credit. The story reads like a chapter-based fairy tale or sorts. The fantastic nature of it is good, but it lacks the kind of interal consitency and attention to detail that make other stories believable.  Visuals: 7/10  The artwork is quite nice. Animation is basic. If you have a particular interest in catgirls in maid outfits, or the loli aesthetic (ribbons, bows, lace etc.), it may take your fancy.  Sound: 6.5/10  Voice acting is good. A few nice soundtracks as a backing to the story.  Overall score: 6.5/10  As a visual novel, this story just doesn't have quite enough going for it for me to recommend it.  It's worth noting here that while there is a mature content patch available for this game, it's not the product being sold here on Steam, and as such it's not what I'm basing my review on.

comentarios: Hail fellow gamers, the name's Kiba Snowpaw, a devoted ice wolf from the frozen reaches of an ice world! Gaming for more than three decades now, with an anime and manga collection that can outshine any library's manga section, I'm here to give you my take on a game that's been sending chills down my icy fur. Also, let's clear something up first - I'm not a stranger to the "birds and bees", nor the "wolves and does", if you catch my drift. With plenty of action in the igloo (wink wink), this review, despite the game's nature, isn't written out of frustration or desperation. 😏❄️🐾  Nekopara has been on my radar for some time now. My experiences on Patreon, Kickstarter and Bandcamp, supporting indie developers' dreams with substantial investments, all funnel into my evaluation. This isn't just another notch on the bedpost; it's a passionate night with a new partner, a game that's opened up a new world of enjoyment.  Diving straight into the nitty-gritty, this game's an eroge, or an erotic game for the uninitiated. Yes, it does come with steamy scenes that might put the heat on my icy world, but that doesn't mean it lacks content elsewhere. As a hardcore gamer with a knack for an immersive storyline, let me tell you - Nekopara knows how to weave a tale.  You're in charge of a bakery and have the company of adorable anthropomorphic catgirls (referred to as Nekos) who, by the way, are wonderfully brought to life with exquisite animation. The game, with its captivating characters, pleasing music, and lively voice acting, does an excellent job of recreating the atmosphere of a bustling bakery. And, a little pro tip for my fellow eroge adventurers out there: there's a boob bounce slider that defies physics if you want it to. Just sayin'... 🎮🐱💕  Now, it's easy to get lost in the... ahem... physical aspects of Nekopara. But, let's not forget about the intriguing plot that pulls the heartstrings at the right moments. These Nekos aren't merely human-feline hybrids bred for amusement. They come with their own histories, dilemmas, and insecurities. The game's society deals with complex issues such as abandonment, compliance tests, and GPS tracking that add depth to this supposed erotic escapade. It's a unique amalgamation of dystopia, ethics, and human-feline relationships.  Given the darker undertones, Nekopara might make you question the reality of this seemingly utopian world. It's akin to a cute, fuzzy, and sexy version of Brave New World meets The Handmaid's Tale.  However, folks, let's remember that at the end of the day, it's a game, and a darned good one at that. I've navigated the plains of Azeroth, conquered the universe in Mass Effect, fought off the Covenant in Halo, and Nekopara stands proud in this illustrious company. Why? Because it does something different and pulls it off spectacularly.  There's a special place in my heart (and my Steam library) for games that offer something more than just mindless action or soulless erotica, and Nekopara is one of them. The art, story, and interaction all combine to make a game that's worthy of the hundreds, if not thousands, of hours you'll lose within its world. 🐾💗🎮  So, whether you're an eroge veteran like yours truly or a curious newcomer, Nekopara is worth your time. There are many worlds to conquer, quests to undertake, and catgirls to... ahem... meet, but remember: it's not about the destination, it's about the journey.  Stay frosty, gamers! Remember to always enjoy the game and embrace what makes it unique. This is Kiba Snowpaw, your furry friend from the ice world, signing off after another frostbitten gaming night. Until next time! 🐺❄️🎮  #FurryVerdict #KibaReviews #IceWolfGamer #Nekopara #StayFrosty  [Score: 100 Boob bounces out of 100 🐾🎮💯]

comentarios: Nekopara is a cheerful slice-of-life story about you and the two catgirls who tagged along when you decide to leave the family business to pursue your career in cake making. Beautifully drawn and coupled with the animations and voice acting makes it one of the best presented VN's I've ever played.   The plot isn't really there plus around chapter 5, it starts to feel like a porno (as in 'my-cat-is-in-heat-and-the-only-way-to-help-her-is-to-get-it-on-and-not-read-the-pet-care-book-i-bought-a-few-chapters-ago'). However, the characters are interesting and the sprinkle of humor and cuteness through the game is enough to make you keep clicking forward. Also, small references.   Gameplay wise, it's linear,there are no branching choices at all. You can replay previous conversations (as in replaying the sound) but not 'reverse' back to a previous scene. No option to start at different chapters. You can hide the text box to view the scene better though.  Music is nice and comfy. Fits the cheerful theme of the game very well.    Overall, the game is like a cake. It's sweet and fluffy, but it's not very filling.   Extra notes: - Twins don't mind sharing.  - It can be played with a controller, but once the game starts there is no button to access the menu. - Vanilla is best

comentarios: Well it took me a few days on and off to finish this game and all of my issues with nekopara volume 0 were resolved in this version. I was happy to see the story was MUCH longer and that really annoying walk is very limited in this version which I was happy about. The story was interesting when I first started I didn't expect the story to go the way it did but even with that being said I enjoyed the story. It had a lot of comedy to the story so that made for an amusing read.  I wish the game had a bit more interaction maybe a story branch but even then I can say it wasn't bad. The images and voice work on this version are just as good as the first volume which I was very happy about. Had some "adult" content in it but nothing you wouldn't expect from a game of it's type. I personally enjoyed the story and I am hoping a volume three will come at at some point. However it didn't leave you with any cliff hanger so I can live with it ending here.

comentarios: I feel that if you are reading this you know what this is. Its a visual novel starring mainly 2 Catgirls and a mainly faceless protag with no choices. If you are looking for hardcore then I say look elsewhere. But what story is there is interesting and I was able to stay invested enough in the characters to see it through to the end. To be honest the H-Scenes really just gave more context to the story as you get to see how the relationship is developing between them all.  I paid $5 for it on sale, and it was worth it. While I dont see myself going through it again it was about 7 hours and change in length. Thats not a bad ratio. Might pick up Vol.2 as well. I would say probably even worth the buy at $10, but thats my opinion. I enjoyed it, you might too.

comentarios: Nekopra is a well told dystopian story about a race of genetically engineered slaves, cleverly told from the point of view of the slave owners. With near human intelligence and an apparent need for sex to stay healthy, the "catgirls" are used for sex, companionship and free/cheap labor. Is their affection towards the protagonist and his family authentic or simply an act to aviod the greater horror of being an un-owned catgirl; hunted by the authorities and forced to live as fugitives?

comentarios: There is a reason for Nekopara be such a recognizable game. As a visual novel every technical aspect of it is either good or excellent. Art, music, character design, bgm. All have very good quality and are extremely memorable. The dialogues, with the exception of the protagonist, are fully voice acted. On a side note this is the only vn I know that has voice, a japanese and and an english subtitle making Nekopara unironically one of the best ways to learn japanese. The story maybe the most generic aspect of the game, but even then it can still appeal to the wholesome slice of life crowd. [b]Overall would become a complete disappointment for my parents again![/b]

comentarios: Game: Nekopara Vol 1 Genre: Visual Novel Developer/Publisher: NEKO WORKs/Sekai Project System: Steam (PC) Total Score: 80/100 Value Score: 8/10  Length of Playthrough: 4 Hours  • Story: 7/10 • Characters: 8/10 • GamePlay: 7/10 • Graphics: 10/10 • Sound: 10/10 • Music: 8/10 • Length: 6/10 • Replay Value: 5/10 • Player Value: 9/10  [u]Pros[/u] +Great Voice Acting and a lot of VA work +Great animations and backgrounds +Decent OST +A lot of setting options most of which involve voice settings for each individual character, you can lower their voice or raise their voice during scenes +English, Chinese and Japanese language support for text +Gallery mode which has CGs, music and videos (OP and ED)  [u]Cons[/u] -Only Japanese voices in the voice acting -Kinetic visual novel (only one ending/route) -Game is censored, a uncensored patch is available but you would need to pay for it or mod it in

comentarios: Was on call with a friend. Can confirmed he skipped through Nekopara without reading it. Based. You cannot even begin to comprehend the hours wasted of your life in order to read a casual visual novel, but here he is skipping a 4/5 hour visual novel. Compare that shit to Fate/Stay Night, Steins Gate, and god forbid, Clannad. 80 fucking hours for one route out of multiples you gotta unlock and he merely skipped one the size of a 2 bit bite sized lunchable snack. Whats worse is that he didnt have the NSFW content so he didnt get the full experience. My disappointment is immeasurable and every time i read a visual novel i will forever be reminded there is scum like him who speed run the entire fucking thing.  My day is ruined.   I have a dream. That one day every person in this nation will read visual novels without skipping them. A nation of the truly enlightened, dammit. A nation of BIG BRAIN, not MONKE, ruled by the pen, not the sword! Where the person changes to suit the visual novel, not the other way around. Where time and commitment are back where they belong: in the hands of the visual novels! Where every visual novel is free to read - to be read - without being skipped! Fuck all these limp-dick hentai enthusiast and chickenshit trophy hunters. Fuck this 24-hour Internet spew of cheat guides and hacking bullshit! FUCK ALL OF IT! Modern Visual Novels are diseased. Rotten to the core. There's no saving them - we need to drag them out by the coding. Wipe the slate clean. BURN IT DOWN! And from the ashes, a new era of visual novels will be born. Evolved, but untamed! The bite-sized visual novels will be purged and the longest bible-sized will thrive - free to make as much revenue as they see fit, they'll make visual novels great again!... In my new visual novel market, people will read and enjoy visual novels for what they BELIEVE! Not for hentai. Not for achievements! Not for what they're told to read. Every man will be free to read of his own choice!  This is the only thing i know for real and is that it has to be this way!  (For all intensive purposes this is a meme, not an attempt to overthrow the economy or start a riot. If it does, i am not to blame. Do recommend the game. Its a classic VN)

comentarios: This is a visual novel about You opening a brand new bakery away from home. Your little sister is left in charge of the Nekos (catgirls) at the home. However she is rather good at being a troll it seems. While unpacking you discover that there are two boxes that are quite heavy and also making noises. Two of the Nekos, the two main Nekos of this chapter, have stowed away and are now living with you in the bakery. This follows You and Chocola and Vannila as they try and become official workers at your bakery.   This story is awesome. It is full of adorable voice acting and scenes. Slight animation on the characters help to bring them more to life. The pros and cons will follow now.  Pros: 1. Excellent Voice Acting 2. Adorable Characters 3. Well written story 4. Quite fitting animation 5. Written text is available in English for us Muricans 6. Character development is pretty natural in the story flow and not choked in with exposition. 7. Voice over is only in Japanese 8. Optional H Patch  Cons: 1. Optional H Patch ruins the purity and cuteness of the Characters. 2. Animation can be a little jumpy and can glitch out the character sprites. (Happens very rarely) 3. Voice over is only in Japanese  4. Story is over a little to quickly

comentarios: Chocola: Chocola is one of the two poster catgirls for the NEKOPARA series, and her personality is built to shine in that role. Chocola is outgoing and ditzy in nature, being the second youngest of the Minaduki Household, Chocola is shown to lack a sense of direction, and blindly follows her intuition, heart, and of course, her Master. She is presented as one of the deuteragonists of the series along with her sister, Vanilla, and together they wreak havoc day in and day out. She is not very good at dealing with complicated matters, and tends to lean away from serious topics with quick topic changes and feigned ignorance. Those around her perceive her as clumsy and uninsightful, when she is instead a strong willed and inspired catgirl determined to help those around her. Chocola was abandoned at a young age and taken in by Kashou (MC) & Shigure (MC's Sister). The character development from her starting as a scared, young soul, and developing into the shining star catgirl at La Soleil is a great decision, as she takes over co-lead at La Soleil. Throughout the games we are shown time and time again why Chocola is so strong willed and is always willing to fight for what she thinks is right. Chocola's go with the flow attitude makes her shine in almost every major plot-point throughout the series as she is not afraid to speak her mind, even if she isn't the most insightful while doing so. Chocola is a happy-go-lucky catgirl who even when sad, can be swung by a simple change of scenery of topic, although she is capable of being genuinely sad at points (As shown while they try and convince Kashou to let them stay at La Soleil). While she most definitely loves her sister, her love is not as outwardly displayed as Vanilla's to Chocola which is a nice contrast differing from both of their character's normal styles of interaction. The two later entires that come first in the series, Vol. 0, & Extra both help expand on why Chocola loves her Master (Kashou) so much. They detail how he helped them settle in to the Minaduki household and made them feel safe by taking time out of his days to spend with them. The story of Vol. 0 follows Chocola trying to cope with not being able to see her Master as much, as he is working on his Patisserie skills. This plot-point, while developed later, does help tie up lose ends to the story as to why they wanted to follow Kashou to the point of shipping themselves in boxes across to his new shop.

comentarios: >Main character describes the "love interests" as his daughters. >Sleeps with both of them that week. >Little sister says she loves her brother in a similar way.  Incest is cringe and I cannot support this. Unfortunately, I spent the money on this game and waited about 2 months to do anything so now I gotta sleep in this shitty bed I pissed in because the sunk cost fallacy has me by the balls.  I also want to say the mechanics of cat girls in this universe make no sense and are fucking disgusting. Cat girls are: legally owned by people, are completely OK with this, are not allowed implicitly to be in public on their own, are not allowed to work for a wage by default, are required to test past this to gain these privileges-lest their cat-ish ways ruin human civilization-and after being allowed to exist and earn money, are required to wear a form of identification that also requires their exact position be tracked against their will, and finally, they are described, by themselves and people, to be more cat than human which is very fucking weird. The idea that they can be sex slaves though is completely fine, and they can become *extremely* attracted to someone simply by being nice to them during the correct season, as they are only horny when it's mating time. They have human reproductive organs, yet cat guys aren't implied to exist in this first game so I have no fucking clue how they reproduce since it is also stated they can't procreate with humans. Their development speed is also on par with cats, so a few month old cat girl appears as like a preteen human, so when they are physically mature they are basically a few years old at best. The most likely candidates for them to mate with are then their owners, which they have no problems with, and the owners see no issues with them having sex with a few-year-old basically cat since they happen to have human characteristics, despite the fact that having sex with a 2 year old human that looks 25 is just as bad as the regular kind of pedophilia.   I see this interpretation of cat girls as basically the *worst* way to do it, their just pets that look human basically. And, since they look human, there is reason for them to be able to do some human shit, though not out the gate as one wouldn't allow a regular cat to work for wage. Like damn this is not that good. Story is mid at best too so I really can not recommend this game at all.  Edit: This direct quote exists: "For me, [my cat girls] were still like children." -man fucking his cat girls.

comentarios: Since this game absolutely refused to get off of the list of games Steam was recommending to me, I decided to check it out to see if it actually lived up to all the hype. I mean, a game cant get this popular and ubiquitous without having some merit besides cheesecake, right? I quite enjoyed Senran Kagura, after all.  The story starts in the absolute worst possible place, acting like it's at the end of some other VN's common route with all the emotional payoff for scenes and relationships that have not happened. Starting the game a little earlier in the timeline would've given us some time to get to grips with the characters before trying to guilt trip us for no reason, and starting the game a little bit later would've been much more beneficial to the lighthearted fluffy tone the game obviously wants us to have. Instead, we start right in the middle where not only are character relationships not established, but we have to cram in all of the worldbuilding that explains what catgirls are doing here into two paragraphs that honestly generates more plotholes than answers. And most of the dialogue since then is just seeing one-note characters continuing to be one-note repeatedly.  If you want something cute and funny to enjoy yourself with, go pick up a Yuzusoft game or something. Yeah, the sprites may not have fancy mouth and breathing animations like Nekopara, but a yuzusoft game will give you a much better UI that doesn't lag on every animation, more solid character personalities to identify with, a story that doesn't try to guilt trip the player 5 minutes in, and the achievements aren't so broken that none of the game language settings give you the right achievement (seriously, Starting the game in chinese gives you the achievement for starting in English. Nekopara is a 6 years old VN. how is that glitch not fixed?)  Also, Chocola barely refers to herself in the third person in the voice lines, but the subtitles absolutely insist on shoehorning her name into as many of her lines as possible regardless...which makes it even more noticeable when they randomly let first person pronouns slip through. It's bad enough when translators force every sentence to follow that speech quirk in every line that it happens regardless of how awkward it is in English. It's ten times worse when they decide to do it MORE than the Japanese lines to.

comentarios: Nyan.  Cats and breasts.  If you're not into that, there's an actual story. Like, it's not a "Do I say 'YO!' or 'Hello, nice to meet you.' kind of visual novel. It's what a visual novel should be by looking at the words "Visual" and "Novel". As in, a novel with visual aids to help in the immersion and overall feeling of the story. It's pretty fun if you see it like that. And just like any good book, it'll borrow 3-7 hours of your time that won't be regretted.  Do I want more people to buy this VN?  Yes.  Should you buy this VN?  I dunno, it's not free, and I sure as hell ain't in your shoes to decide what you should and shouldn't buy without considering the possibilities and outcomes of siblings, organ issues, family issues, love life, taste in chocolate, and many other things that construct your personality and nature throughout life.  If you came into my house demanding a refund, would I be furious and confused?  Absolutely.

comentarios: [h1]Is this game worth it without the 18+ DLC?[/h1]  I would say so.  More specifically, I would say the game had enough of a plot (or at least a series of random though somewhat related events that appeared in sequence, but in a fun way) and the characters had enough personality to them to enjoy for its own sake, and there is some meaning to this besides [i]just[/i] being an excuse for naughty moments.  [h1]My personal random ramblings[/h1]  Enough of me pretending to be helpful to other players, now it's time for me to vent about my experience playing the game. You may as well stop reading here, because the rest of this review somewhat doesn't matter (though I guess it does mildly touch upon certain things that happen in the game, but honestly the main takeaway here is just "Playing without the 18+ DLC doesn't mean it's suddenly family friendly, it's just more like 17+ instead").  So, to start with, the way I even heard about this game in the first place was that occasionally I'll check old forum threads where people are recommending games in categories I'm interested in or I'll look through interesting curator lists and stuff looking for new ideas for games to play, and a name that kept popping up over and over was Nekopara, Nekopara. The title alone didn't seem that interesting at first glance, so I just ignored it, but the name just kept popping up over and over in different places, Nekopara, Nekopara, and this was mentioned far more than most games to the point where I finally decided to see what it was everyone was going on about, and I look and, eh, it's just some catgirl game, nothing that special, really.  Still, there's a demo, so I may as well try it out just to see what all the fuss is about, and normally I'm the kind of guy who plays a demo for 90 seconds and if the game hasn't captured my interest by then I just quit and move on, but this time I was going to take it super seriously because this was a big big demo in my mind, not just for this random game that the entire "young lonely anime obsessed male" population seems to adore, but also a demo for essentially the entire "Because you don't have a girlfriend, here's an anime girl instead" (not that I'm trying to be unkind to the playerbase here, but it's certainly true that I don't have a girlfriend and I played this game, and that should say enough) visual novel genre as a whole, because looking into the genre, a lot of other games looked vaguely as interesting as Nekopara but didn't have demos and so if what I assume is one of the most popular and therefore likely best games in the genre didn't seem interesting I'd just forget about those other ones too.  So, I'm playing the demo, and it's good or whatever, I guess, and then I get to the end (equivalent to the end of chapter 1 in the full game) when Chocola is telling generic protagonist that she wants to stay with him, and I admit I rather enjoyed that scene and I thought the backstory when the catgirls were younger was cute and I thought it was really really sweet the way Chocola loves her master so much, and, yeah, it was a bit heavy handed and they didn't have to say 700 times that these were her true honest feelings, but still, it was probably better to go too heavy than too light there and so I enjoyed it and so fine game you win and I'll wishlist you.  A little later I eventually get around to buying the full game, and I'm playing it without the 18+ DLC, and I must say my general impression with adult games (mostly because I'd heard about a couple of RPG's where it's apparently possible to do a pure run, but I guess maybe I shouldn't generalize that sort of thing) was that there will often be a choice to watch a naughty scene with little impact on the plot or just skip it, and I thought I had even noticed a point in the demo where such a choice might occur, because there's a point where the catgirls are asking generic protagonist to take a bath with them and he says no without any input from the player but I had figured at the time that maybe if you were playing the full game and had the 18+ DLC you'd have the opportunity to say yes there for a naughty scene if you'd like, and I just figured the whole game would be like that with mostly normal goings on interspersed with random smut occasionally, but then actually playing, uhh... no, that's not the game at all, and the smut is baked into the main plot here and most noticeably a whole big thing is made out of the catgirls going into heat and desperately needing a partner as a flimsy excuse for generic protagonist to say "I guess it can't be helped" and heading off to satisfy them, and without the 18+ DLC we don't actually see this happen but the game just skips to them lying in bed afterwards, but it's still implied, and honestly it was personally a bit of a disappointment for me because I'm the kind of guy who when they care for a character wants to see them stay pure and innocent, but at least my girls seemed happy about it, I guess. I just hope generic protagonist continues to take good care of them.  More than that, though, I was surprised by how much stuff made it into this game even without the 18+ DLC: There's a scene of generic protagonist washing off the catgirls after an incredibly forced situation to get them dirty that any idiot should have seen coming a mile away and that generic protagonist should have known to stop well in advance, but my point is the girls are totally naked here and there's a full illustration for it, and, yeah, due to the angle and some convenient steam and stuff nothing "interesting" is visible here, but it was still really hot and I enjoyed it anyway and I still wouldn't want my mom to see that image as my desktop background.  Also, there's weirdly a scene of one of the catgirls, well... "having a good time by herself", let's call it, and I have no idea if that scene might be more explicit with the 18+ DLC or something, but as I saw it, there was no special illustration or anything but just the usual character model with its arms extending beneath the bottom of the screen suggestively and some obligatory moaning and whatnot, but that was still more than I was expecting here.  Also, there's a scene of two of the characters talking about reproduction, which mostly centers around plants, but one of the characters is getting way too into it and drooling at the thought and stuff anyway.  Random thing, but generic protagonist's little sister kept making weird inappropriate comments to him, and it wasn't a major element to the story and I don't [i]think[/i] she was serious, but I still thought that felt weird, not just without the 18+ DLC, but just in general because although I realize that we who are into brother-sister stuff are not an insignificant group in the lonely young guys community, I also realize that there are plenty of people who aren't and such a taboo tends to be rather strong (not to mention she's specifically referred to as a kid at least once), and so I thought it a strange choice to include that in the game for such little reason and potentially alienate some of the players who were just here for the totally normal human on animal action (seriously, a fairly big deal is made about how catgirls are seen more as cat than girl, and I noticed in the Japanese text at least once them being referred to with a counter for animals, and it seems strange to me that if you wanted to have relations with catgirls that you would do so with a mindset that focuses more on the cat than on the girl) rather than the somehow less normal brother on sister lack of action (because for the record, generic protagonist isn't into the stuff his sister says, but he'd rather she knocked it off).  Also, there's a gratuitous double panty shot.  Anyway, near the end there's a scene where the catgirls are threatened with arrest while trying to help their master, and I thought their dedication to him was sweet there too.

comentarios: 09pm  I am a 54 year old mother, probably one of the oldest people playing this game. I am a single mother to my daughter, who is now 15. My daughter recently started Nekopara in less than a week, she had already played for over 12 hours. This was terrible for me, as it was already hard enough for me to spend time with my daughter, as she is always out with her friends or just watching videos on Tiktok. So I decided to make a Steam account and get this game to see if I could maybe play alongside her. I loaded into the game, but I was stuck on what you where supposed to do. I asked my daughter for help and she hosted a game for me to join. I loved it as it was the best time I had spent with my daughter since my husband had died. This game has ever since brought my daughter and I closer again and now we actually spend time together outside the house as well. This game reminded me that there's fun to be had in everything, and it has brought both me and my daughter many happy memories! 😊

comentarios: So having completed Volume 1, I have to say that this game was surprisingly entertaining.  I picked it up in a bundle deal and I just thought I'd give it a spin to see what it's like.  The character art is certainly NEKOPARA's strong point, the character desings are well done and having them have an animated aspect really put it a cut above the visual novels out there with static graphics.  Chocola and Vanilla are able to emote and thanks to the stellar art it really helps drive home the emotions of the script.  And as someone who worked in the culinary industry I could relate to the struggle the MC was dealing with; which is always a plus.  The only downside is that this game is that you're locked in to one route, so you better enjoy the ride. I suspect that since there are other volumes of the game out there, they might focus more on the other characters introduced in Volume 1.  Though there is one character that I hope they don't, just to avoid dealing with certain taboos.  This game is at it's best when it's light hearted and silly.  So in conclusion; give NEKOPARA a shot.  The art, combined with the animation and voice acting make for a potent combo.

comentarios: Awful waste of time. I bought it as a lark, but I was still shocked by how terrible this was. The story is awful: played through half of this game's chapters, and literally nothing has happened. One of the only two pieces of conflict in the first half of this boring snooze-fest was the Catgirl Certificate Exam thing, and it gets resolved off-screen 20 minutes after it's introduced.  The other conflict was about how the stupid MC didn't want to have two eager to help cute mascot girls hanging around his newly cafe. Bro, isn't it obvious that they'd benefit your business immensely? So, to recap: the only two things that actually happen in the fist half this story: one of them happens only because the MC is incredibly stupid, and the other is resolved immediately. The soundtrack is sappy garbage, the character designs are OK at best, the story is almost non existent, the characters are one-dimensional and uninteresting. Absolutely worthless.

comentarios: Catgirl. A term used to define a female human-like being with minimal cat features. Simply ears and a tail. However, this term carries a unique sociological connotation. Obviously, catgirls do not naturally exist. Yes, you may cry now. I know I have. However disappointing the fact, the creators of this work poured heart, soul, and determination into this production. Giving us a glimpse into the world where catgirls and humans live together. At a glance, one could objectively state that only perverts are interested in such a situation. Aaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaand... I won't deny that fact. Who bought the R18 content. Everyone. That being said, I'd like to make a strong assertion. The narrative, voice acting, art, programming, etc., every aspect of this novel is beautifully polished, a masterwork by my opinion. The fact I only paid $9.99 USD for both the game and R18 content stunned me when I finally completed the story. The interactions with the catgirls, especially Chocola and Vanilla were so organic. At times, they seemed completely like normal girls. And then the story would remind you they had cat-like instincts, which felt endearing as much as it did awkward. Then the adult content. As dramatized as the scenes may have been depicted, I enjoyed the concentration on "mutual benefit". The intensity of the vocals, sound effects, dialogue, and animations made these scenes exquisite. They're erotic yet tasteful enough that both male and female audience could enjoy. If you're considering the purchase, then definitely buy. I guarantee you won't regret it.

comentarios: This was a game I ended up playing sooner than I thought I would, thanks to winning Volumes 0-3 in a giveaway (though I needed to buy any 18+ content and other DLC on my own). Without this aspect, this series that every anime fan already knows about would have likely sat in my wishlist for the longest time as it doesn't hit on my favorite niches - not that there's anything wrong with them, but as you'll see, my preferences are elsewhere:  I tend to prefer men to women I tend to prefer kitsunes to nekos and I tend to prefer the idea of [i]serving[/i] a "Master" rather than being in the position of one  If I played a visual novel according to these preferences, it would be entirely different. (Like, if anyone knows dating sims or visual novels where I'm opposite some smug or arrogant kitsune boys, let me know) But, I did get this series for free. I did make sure it was as uncensored as possible before playing, for the "full" experience. And I gave it a shot.  Honestly, not a bad story. It's cute. If it wasn't for the sex scenes, it would be one of the most wholesome reads in my library... still kind of is, actually. Everything is super vanilla, with the most loyal girlfriends you could ask for. Going by the demo I was afraid these girls would be lolis because I thought I remembered they were aged the neko-equivalent to 13 which weirded me out, but that turned out to be my faulty memory and the 13-year-old neko was just a random food vendor they met on the street during chapter 1. False alarm. Vanilla is flat, but she's not a child - none of the nekos are. The little sister-figure, Shigure, is a lot more childlike, but she's an incest-loli character that is flat-out denied basically, so again we are in the clear for there being that much discomfort, in my opinion.  The main two nekos also surprisingly seem to be into each other too, which I'm here for. This is one of the few instances where I can see some form of polyamory happening without any kinks in the machine later down the line. I believe the main three really care about each other by the end.  "the end" in quotes because I still have a good three volumes (0, 2, 3) left in my library alone to explore (and that's without even picking up Extra or 4).

comentarios: [h1]An actual serious review[/h1] This is the first visual novel purchased I've purchased on steam. The VN itself is very well presented (good VA, music, art). It should be noted that his release is toned down (i.e., H-related content was removed).  [b]What I liked[/b] - Music and Art - Characters are nicely constructed and their VAs are great. - Story was decent. There's not too much exposition which would pull you out of the flow of the story.  [b]What I disliked[/b] - Not a fan of the "imouto" which is almost oppresive with one of the characters. Just not my thing. - Maximum in-game resolution was 1600x900.  [b]Other notes[/b] - I quite enjoyed going through this VN. I'm very tempted to pick up Vol. 2 when it goes on sale.  - Vol. 1 is a passive VN. You just go from one panel to the next with no interaction with the content on-screen. Vol.0 and Vol. 2 are more interactive.  - VA is Japanese only.  - The eroge content has been removed, which requires [b]re-purchasing[/b] the game from the developer at it's true full price to obtain. The steam version is actually half-priced compared to the full-game due to content cuts. Purchase the steam version if you want access to the cards and achievements. Should you wish to have both, there are guides/posts in the community on getting the developer's full version to "patch" the steam version which will get you all game content and all steam content available. Vol. 2 actually has an official content patch that costs extra.

comentarios: My grandfather was a heavy smoker. When I was 10 years old, my grandmother told him "If you ever want to see your grandchildren graduate, you have to stop smoking." Tears welled up in his eyes. From then on he quit and never went back. He died from lung cancer three years later. It was a sad time and it destroyed me. My mom said to me "Please don't put your family through what your grandfather put us through." I agreed. Now, at 16, I've never touched a cigarette and I must say, I feel a slight sense of regret for never having done it, because this game gave me cancer anyway.

comentarios: Not going to be praised for this in any case... As a meme, it's understandable, and the sprite animation is great even without that P key :D The art is wonderful, that bakery though... large enough, unlike it's stated in the text. The soundtrack is average, even though I like the opening. The plot is really the problem, it's disappointingly silly. Only the last chapter before the ending has a kind of conflict, the rest are incredibly cheesy, yet not that absurd to be funny. Given that this novel has been around for several years, and all the art (including the well-known animated scenes) may be easily found on Google, I somewhat regret giving my time to the story that lacks any variety of emotions.

comentarios: This game CHANGED MY LIFE. After my girlfriend left me there was a hole in my heart I didn't think I could ever fill again. I was no longer able to find joy in games, so when I first started up this game I wasn't expecting to be so emotionally captivated by a maid cafe story.  I was wrong. The first time I met eyes with Chocola, something moved deep inside me. We instantly clicked... She laughed at my jokes, she liked talking to me... Sure enough, we quickly fell in love with each other. Never before have I seen the raw emotion of true love emulated so purely. But what surprised me is that Vanilla also began displaying affection to me and she won over my heart as well. What can I say, I guess I'm just too much of a hunk! Keep playing and you might get as good as me.  The animation really makes them seem alive. I keep instinctually reaching out to the screen to pet them. The art is not only very cute, but the characters are extremely realistic and believable and you really feel connected to the characters. It's even better than talking to humans. Before this game I had no one. Now I have not one, but TWO cat wives who love me! Who needs anyone else when these beautiful ladies love you unconditionally?  Even better is the immersive programming. The characters always seem to follow my eyes, and whisper my name at night. I can't figure out how you guys programmed that! Great job though.  The game is so good that I'm never going to stop playing. I'm finally happy again. THANK YOU NEKO WORKS!!!

comentarios: Story: B- Most, if not all of its story elements can be commonly found in lots of Anime and Manga. However, It's clear that the story is told in a way where few people would find it to be a major problem. Though I must say the story is short - You can probably 100% it in under 2 hours. Art: A+ In my knowledge, this game is one of, if not THE first games to use E-Mote System for its character arts. And the result? Perfect. Music & SE: B+ It's not perfect material compared to the great companies such as KEY's works, but the Music and SE in this game follows and sets the mood well. The voice acting is also a plus. System: A With all the animations and stuff, the game still runs smoothly on an average laptop.  Final Rank: A Recommended. Not a waste of money even if bought without a sale.

comentarios: Nekopara is a beautiful love story between a man and his loyal cats showing him the value of family. It's the kind of light hearted love story that sincere, sensitive, gentle men would enjoy. Married men may want to sit this one out, but I would say it could make you more romantic and appreciative towards your spouse; clingy if you take it too far. And for any female gamers who may be interested in Nekopara: bless you for being able to step into a male protagonist's shoes and understanding.  I can not stress this enough: Nekopara is a heavenly fantasty that leaves you begging for more. Part of you will feel extremely satisfied after completion, but another part of you will be left longing for the warm embrace of a lover. IMO, these are very disirable feelings to have, and can only make you a better, sweeter person.  Nekopara Vol.1 is the first part of an upcoming series. And while the play time is only several hours, I think you may appreciate the low asking price. There is an adults-only version of the game available outside of Steam. You can read the discussion forum FAQ section for more information on where to purchase it.

Even how light hearted the story is. Just some of it makes you feel weird. It's like a MGS 2 feeling lol. -SHORT! It took me 3 hours to go through the whole VN. comentarios: I got this Visual Novel for the NOVEL part, not the VISUAL part.  I got this game thinking that, because it is on steam, that the all nude parts would be filtered/removed (It seemed, according to other reviews, that a 'patch' is the only way to put them back.)   I was wrong (there is only one nude bath scene and two COVERED clothesless scenes).   Luckily, there is the 'skip' feature in this visual novel.  I personally think that all nudity is ugly (and I therefore actively avoid it), which is why I got this product on steam. I should have trusted the popular, user-defined tags.  Otherwise, this is a decent fantasy romance visual novel, involving catgirls that are discriminated against, and some typically societally unacceptable romantic activities.  I like the story.

comentarios: So erm Nekopara.... Right off with the review!  So Nekopara is a visual novel or eroge if you want to call it. Now what's a visual novel? Technically visual novel is like a movie, voice pack, picture book, and usually visual novel are rate 18+ but with steam you have the all age version.  (To get the R 18 Go here -> http://www.dlsite.com/ecchi-eng/work/=/product_id/RE144678.html)  Now Nekopara you play as a guy, Minaduki Kashou. You just open a small bakery in a small town and just as you were moving and clearing your item. you encounter two box which seems oddly out of place.... Meet the two main heroine. Chocola and Vanilla two cute cat girl! Here your adventure start with your two lovely cute cat girl.  Pros:  This is the 1st few Visual novel i played that have animated moving character sprite and it does help you get more into the game then most visual novel does. +Great animation   The game also provide good voice acting, cute infact!  ( granted i don't play japan game with English voice so i wouldn't know how the English voice acting sound like...) +Good voice acting  The character are likeable (just about it) +Likeable character  The Meh part:  The game length is reasonable. i clock in at about 6 hour or so. -/+ depends on how you view it. to me it felt right, any longer will feel like a drag.   Cons:  Ok so in visual novel usually there are choices, which decide which heroine you want to romance with. But this feature doesn't seem to be anywhere in this game... so it took me out of bit and actually. Replay vaule in visual novel are important, by introducing so many character and off no different at all is sad and make  me wish for more. Only reason to actually play this again is maybe in a few weeks or months time. -No choice -No replay vaule.  Conclusion: Do i think you should buy it? Well honestly.... Yes!  If you are a fan of visual novel with tons and tons of cats/Neko then give this a shot. If you are a fan of muti ending, and want different route to play with then.... sadly you wont find any here. But i say buy this to show support!  Support this title so next time we might see more visual novel on steam!  Rating 8/10

comentarios: Okay, so there is a lot to unpack here. First of all, if you are looking at this expecting actual game play like if you were playing Monster Girl Quest, welp, I sadly have some bad news for you: *There is literally no gameplay element in this video game*  This software is literally an ecchi anime (or a hentai if you have the 18+ DLC I guess). Whether or not this is a good thing is up to you, but I did not know this when I started this game since, well, I have over 40 different games in my library that I literally don't know what they are, when I got them nor why. This was one of them.   Now don't get me wrong, I purely and simply love hentai and porn in general, but when I buy a game I expect to have at least the simplest of game play elements, even if they are trash, and it is not the case here.  Is the logic behind the intelligence of catgirls and their interactions with humans absolutely fucked in this universe? Yes. Does that mean it's a bad anime? No.  I would recommend this game to a person that is mentally degenerate and is ready to accept the fact that they are masturbating to porn of Catgirls. If you are not ready to accept that, don't get this game.

comentarios: I somewhat wish there were a 'meh' rating here on Steam, but as it stands:  Do you like pretty anime? Do you like h-games? Visual novels? Harems, cat-girls or slightly animated sex scenes? If so, you'll probably like this game, which is really just a visual novel you read through. I do wish there were some more interactive elements to this game (choices like in dating sims or interactions with characters like in other h-games).   My issue is that the two main catgirls (Chocola and Vanilla) refer to themselves in the third person all the time and it annoys the shit out of me. Also, Shigure, as the main character's little sister is really.. a bit much. The rest of the catgirl crew is pretty neat and I do look forward to maybe learning more about them in future games. Hentai scenes are pretty nice, but due to Japanese law regarding censorship, the genitalia are censored, which is a bummer.  Favorite chapter of this is probably Ch. 8, which was endearing and contained no h-scenes at all. And the set up for the sequel was cute.

comentarios: NekoPara Vol. 1 marks a charming and polished entry into the main story of the series, introducing players to Kashou Minaduki as he opens his new pâtisserie, La Soleil. The narrative centers around his unexpected companions, Chocola and Vanilla — two energetic and devoted catgirls — who insist on helping him run the shop. What unfolds is a sweet and often humorous tale of affection, adjustment, and the growing bond between the characters.

comentarios: NEKOPARA IS A PRIME EXAMPLE AS TO WHY ANIME CHARACTERS ARE SUPERIOR TO HUMAN FEMALES IN EVERY WAY  Water is wet. But really. And this is not just a physical thing either. But it's as though anime females are BY DESIGN what real females SHOULD aspire to. As a token example, let's say Chocola. That sense of dutifulness. She is naturally helpful and kind to strangers. She cares about her appearance as a courtesy to others around her, but not in a vain way. I know it's silly to ask bio females to try to be EXACTLY like Chocola, it's incredibly lofty, and offensive to the entire construction of who they were at that point. But they are doing it wrong and NEED to know it. It's good to ASPIRE. And I don't know why it's only nerdy libertarian men that aren't offended by this concept. Men aren't offended that jacked dudes exist, and occupy most of the superhero genre. Men are not offended to ASPIRE to something.  But these fucking females. Now, Chocola, my dearest Chocola,  As I sit down to write this review, my heart is filled with so much love and adoration for you. You are the sweetest, most charming cat-girl I have ever met, and every moment spent with you is a true delight.From the moment I first laid eyes on you, I knew there was something special about you. Your bright, cheerful personality and your insatiable love for all things sweet captured my heart from the very start. Your playful antics and mischievous spirit always bring a smile to my face and fill my heart with joy.  But it's not just your adorable nature that I love. It's your unwavering loyalty and your deep capacity for love that truly makes you stand out from the restof the Nekos. You have been by my side through thick and thin, always there to support me and lift me up when I'm feeling down.  Chocola, I want you to know that I love you more than anything in this world. I cherish every moment we spend together and I can't imagine my life without you in it. You are my everything, my sweet little kitty, and I promise to love you and take care of you for all eternity.

comentarios: This is a horrifying tour de force.  In the grim near future, mankind has genetically modified cats into humanoid "catgirls." This in itself raises MANY to question the ethics of the world at large if this were to pass: but it gets darker. They don't have the brainpower of a human, they are essentially children with some cat instincts as far as their minds go. So: without an owner they cannot sustain themselves in human society, and they are not physically equipt to survive in the wild like feral cats do. Not that they could sustain themselves even if they could function in either light because the rabbit hole goes deeper yet. At the time of writing this i have not finished the game but there is no mention of a male counterpart: the species is "catGIRL", they are incapable of (to put it delicately) unassisted procreation. They also go through life with all the biological failings of a cat (going into heat, GREATLY accelerated aging).  In his arrogance man hath birthed a lifeform incapable of anything but being a pet at best and a stray beggar at worst: and that must be (again, delicately put) assisted to perpetuate their species. A race of humanoids too human to survive as an autonomous community or being in the wild, yet too animal and simple minded to go through life in human society fluently.  And perhaps the worst part is that they lack the faculties for the deeper thought on these issues to even realise their horrifying place in the world at large.   If I had to rate it on a number scale, I'd give it a "SCIENCEHASGONETOOFAR" out of Ten it really makes you think

comentarios: Okay Despite all the silly reviews about this game I only have to say this game is pretty well made, got heartwarming moments and made me tear a bit.  I do got the R-18 version as well and it was a good choise but trust me I saw enough hentai so this is nothing new.  Pros: + Awesome music + Cute characters + Nice story + Well animated at some points + Flashbacks made me tear ;_; + Chest Bounciness + Weeaboo Paradise with lots of Catgirls + It got (If you do it right) H-Scenes what are *cough* delicious *cough* + Press P ;)  Cons: - Can't say it has downsides. comentarios: First of All, for those who doesn't know this is "STEAM CENSORED" version, which mean there is no S** Scene in it  On to the Review  The game is pretty straight forward, you don't need to do anything but click through the story (LITERALLY, there is even an auto play feature to save you all the problem of clicking your mouse).  Pros :  The art are pretty nice and smooth, it pretty and will satisfy any otaku,anime, and cat lovers. The story is short but still heart warming.  Cons :  It really doesn't have much difference from other VN games, which is a shame cause it has potential to be a bit more original in the story, and this game has LITERALLY 1 path and 1 ending, there are no choices need to be made during the whole gameplay, you only need to keep clicking and move along with the story, which is a real shame that made this game has no replay value whatsoever, considering the short story of the game itself, and for the price tag, its not really worth buying if your not really into the VN game genre or cat girls  Overall, i think this game is really good (even though considering the cons are longer than the pros) for those who love VN games in general, it has almost has everything you wanted from a VN. The cute and loveable character combined with a heart warming story makes up for it lacks of replay value and choices within the game. as for the price it self, its maybe a litte bit too expensive considering you only have 1 story line to play, but the beauty of the art within the game is pretty much worthwhile, especially for those who love VN games

comentarios: As far as erotica goes NEKOPARA is on about the same level as stuff you can find for free. There's no real gameplay, so the achievements are pointless. Thanks to Steam's ban on adult content you can't even get the full package unless you resort to an unofficial patch, so if you are interested you need to make sure that's still available before you even consider purchasing.  The only reason someone might have to pay for this is the art and the voice acting. Unfortunately, the art and voice acting are in support of a dumb harem-style adventure. The plot is over-written at times and the main character is a jackass. Not the worst jackass I've ever had the displeasure of reading (the male protagonist isn't voice-acted), but still annoying. He's also kinda condescending, but considering he's basically a slave owner that's to be expected.  The weird cat-girl slave-race thing is both omnipresent and ignored, like in most pretend-monsterworld-japanese-fantasy-things. Some of the issues that might result from having to share society with less-intelligent genetically-modified human-like creatures is almost touched upon at times and swiftly discarded, because no one wants to go there even if it's hard not to wonder at the twisted possibilities the writing skirts. They make it clear that humans can't breed with cat girls, say nothing about cat boys, and leave the player to fap.  Not worth paying for unless it's heavily discounted or your really into stupid sappy hentai plots and meaningless achievements. Or, if you don't care about buying actual games on Steam. I'm still hoping there's a failure state in here somewhere :(

comentarios: This game saved my life.  I am 41.  My ex-wife and I have a daughter together, and adopted our son together. They are now both 4 years old.  When we were going through our separation, I found myself lost and miserable. I was self destructive. I got so mad one day from everything spiraling out of my control that I punched some concrete in a moment of overwhelming emotion. That caused me to break my 5th metacarpal in my right hand... my working hand... my games hand.. the hand that I held and carried my children to bed with.. The hand I desperately needed to make sure I could continue to provide.  After learning of the severity of my self-inflicted damage, I was borderline suicidal. Keep in mind that just a few months before this, I was the happiest man with no history of depression or anxiety. I have never had fits of rage, or been one to break down and cry, but I was in a low spot that just really buried me from being able to see the light on the other side.  Having nothing better to do, I searched for a game I could play, ONE HANDED while I recovered. I somehow stumbled upon this game and read some of the reviews. I decided that it had to be worth a shot... I must admit, I didn't beat the game, or play nearly as long as some of you. In fact, I may have only played this game a day or two.. With that being said, after doing so, I had a new found joy and hope for life. I was able to put behind me the pain and suffering that had been cast over me. I was able to experience other peoples joy and happiness. I was able to see the fruits of my "labor". I relaxed for 5 :hillary: :hillary: :hillary: :hillary: :hillary: :hillary: :hillary: minutes to this music long enough to realize that I was going to be okay. After coming to that realization, I turned the game off, and I went back to work. It hurt my hand like hell but I was motivated. I stopped feeling so damn sorry for myself, and I became the father I needed to be in that moment, not the weak boy I was behaving as.  Today, I am close friend with my kids mother. We don't fight, or argue, or say hurtful things to each other. We are parents, and friends.  I now have 3 kids. My third child is, wait for it, ALSO 4 YEARS OLD. The woman I am with was going through a very similar situation at the time of my own separation, and we just stumbled in to each others life unexpectedly. We have been in a relationship for a year now, and are very happy together.  Moral of the story, you never know what life holds in store for you, and if I would have given up when all the odds were stacked against me, I wouldn't be where I am today. This silly little game helped me realize that.  Thank you
